Thanks Carlos!'}, {'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2018-09-19 17:24:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2

LGTM'}, {'account_id': 6579, 'date': '2018-09-20 14:41:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

I have been testing this patch for a few hours now.
The example Carlos brought forward clearly indicates that this patch does bring value and resolve a leak. Thus my vote +2.

Nevertheless, my repeated testings show that the leak (or just faulty memory usage by neutron-server if you will) that was indicated in the story still happens when periodically creating and deleting listeners.

I used this[1] script to test it and to sample the overall neutron-server memory consumption.

In master branch (in devstack):
neutron-server memory usage started at: 283.697MB
neutron-server memory usage ended at: 575.225MB

In Redhat OSP10 (Newton based):
neutron-server memory usage started at: 330.712MB
neutron-server memory usage ended at: 944.445MB


I will continue to look into this.

[1] https://github.com/nmagnezi/scripts/blob/master/testers/mem_leak/lbaas_mem_sampler.sh'}, {'account_id': 6469, 'date': '2019-06-14 14:38:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Cherry Picked

This patchset was cherry picked to branch stable/rocky as commit f243150233080db567582773115904792dd3fe6b'}]

[{'created': '2018-09-18 17:59:11.000000000', 'message': 'Fix memory leak in the haproxy provider driver

The haproxy provider driver uses a dict for caching load balancer
resources (including children resources). That alone already increases
memory consumption. A neutron-server restart solves this.

But the real issue is that the driver leaves some data behind when a LB
is deleted without freeing it up (unless neutron-server is restart)
hence the memory leak.

Story: 2003802
Task: 26534

Change-Id: I7c79271998d839c6afbeb6d92f888f6acd67704e

commit_message:
Fix memory leak in the haproxy provider driver

The haproxy provider driver uses a dict for caching load balancer
resources (including children resources). That alone already increases
memory consumption. A neutron-server restart solves this.

But the real issue is that the driver leaves some data behind when a LB
is deleted without freeing it up (unless neutron-server is restart)
hence the memory leak.

Story: 2003802
Task: 26534

Change-Id: I7c79271998d839c6afbeb6d92f888f6acd67704e

commit_message:
package rootwrap filters for ironic-lib

It seems ironic services (which are using ironic-lib)
require these rootwrap filters to be available. It isn't
100% clear to me whether they need to be under ironic/rootwrap.d
or whether we can patch the rootwrap config to include ironic-lib..

Change-Id: Iaa8dba6254492cedd1d3d7c1f4b5c6d505c189e4
(cherry picked from commit 0880edd48f851c99f94c888528d67a527e75f89e)

commit_message:
package rootwrap filters for ironic-lib

It seems ironic services (which are using ironic-lib)
require these rootwrap filters to be available. It isn't
100% clear to me whether they need to be under ironic/rootwrap.d
or whether we can patch the rootwrap config to include ironic-lib..

Change-Id: Iaa8dba6254492cedd1d3d7c1f4b5c6d505c189e4
(cherry picked from commit 0880edd48f851c99f94c888528d67a527e75f89e)

commit_message:
Fix for utils LB DM transformation function

Fixing utils function for common LB data model transformation
to provider driver data model which does not consider
a Vip data model object.
Unit test which didn't cover this bug was modified.

Change-Id: Ib3d5eb1f27ec1f10ed0f73b342927b78f1a237c7
Implements Story: 2003733

commit_message:
Add missing affinity keys to chart pod specs

This adds the affinity key to the pod spec for the grafana,
nagios, kube-state-metrics, and openstack-exporter charts as it
was previously missed

Change-Id: Ifefa88d7f33607b4d595effa5fbf72f3387e5081
Signed-off-by: Steve Wilkerson <sw5822@att.com>

commit_message:
Remove cells v1 parameter from 'ComputeTaskAPI.resize_instance'

The 'extra_instance_updates' parameter was only used by cells v1 and can
therefore be removed.

Part of blueprint remove-cells-v1

Change-Id: I70012f7be863afc9d9ed8882cc5d9d193bbb7b6d
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Fix response always being False

From requests.models.Response:
Returns True if :attr:`status_code` is less than 400.

We're using it wrong, so have changed it to "is not None"

Change-Id: I617e55d67d93f1e07f5192ba94dcc0997ba9e12f

commit_message:
Set cache_backend for token caching

'fernet' is the token provider since octata. As we've memcached
in the undercloud, we should enable caching by setting
cache_backend to 'dogpile.cache.memcached'.

Change-Id: I4b040d25b2cb83f40cbd8e8caf6890feba586b60
Closes-Bug: #1832437

commit_message:
Add 'dns_publish_fixed_ip' attribute to Subnet

Add a new attribute ``dns_publish_fixed_ip`` into ``subnet``
resource. This attribute will be used to indicate whether to publish DNS
records for fixed IPs from this subnet.

Neutron patch: https://review.opendev.org/662409

Thanks go to [0] which I took as a reference to create this patch.

[0] I1371fc0b47c0015423e4346ffd43d39c8264b1a3

Change-Id: I08ef19fcc06559c92ae3f8e6e66c5fd896815232
Partial-Bug: 1784879

commit_message:
Unblock the gates (fix for bandit, workaround for stestr)

They are really two workarounds, even though the bandit one is more likely
to stay.
- bandit: exclude 1.6.0, which has a regression in the handling of patterns.
  A fix is in place in bandit master, so newer versions should work.
  The version is excluded there because is not handled by global requirements.
- stestr: exclude the only py3 test. The discovery seems to work with
  the current stestr master (most likely thanks to
  https://github.com/mtreinish/stestr/pull/241), but a new version does
  not seems in sight, so let's disable the test for now.

Change-Id: I041b5cd41b089b2c1dc043f1e252c1f6b3c29db3

commit_message:
Fix a warning about flags in an expression string

In python 3, flags should be used first in the expression string.
So fix an expression string in a unit test.

*: https://docs.python.org/3/library/re.html#regular-expression-syntax

Change-Id: I7af958ffb615979a0bad9c8f56a33256ed305aa2
Closes-Bug: #1832670

commit_message:
Fix coe_version for k8s driver

Now the coe_version is out of sync with the k8s version deployed
for the cluster. This patch will make sure the kube_version is
consistent with the kube_tag when creating the cluster and upgrading
the cluster.

Task: 33608
Story: 2002210

Change-Id: I5812dac340099ecd8923c1e4a60ce0e6611f7ca4

commit_message:
Configure the region-related settings for core components

These settings become mandatory in a multi-region deployment.

Updated settings for cinder, glance, heat, neutron and nova.

Change-Id: I15aa7ec663da4e29e935b5c4b5819307977f5682

In your driver you are mixing volume driver functionality with target driver functionality (cinder/volume/targets/). I think it would be a better idea to create separate target driver here. Target driver should also inherit from nvmeof.NVMeOF class. This way it will simplify this code.'}, {'account_id': 4523, 'date': '2018-12-05 15:28:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 15961, 'date': '2018-12-06 01:19:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

@Maciej Szwed, the connection-related interfaces are also defined in BaseVD class. I think when a target is sharable between different storage devices it is better to split as a standalone target. This can refer to existed drivers. Currently, RSD target is only used by RSD, so let's keep the current method, and update it later if needed."}, {'account_id': 15648, 'date': '2018-12-06 02:00:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 15648, 'date': '2018-12-06 02:23:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

The documented requirement for third party CI retriggering is "run-Intel RSD CI".

commit_message:
Cinder RSD Driver

Add a new Cinder Driver for Intel RSD with NVMeoF support:
- report stats
- create volume
- delete volume
- attach volume
- detach volume
- create snapshot
- delete snapshot
- create volume from snapshot
- clone volume
- extend volume
- copy volume to image (reuse the base-class impl)
- copy image to volume (reuse the base-class impl)
- host-assisted volume migration (reuse the manager code)
- unit tests
- release-note
- documentation

Change-Id: Ie83dab4858729353865268231352033934dafdc2
Implements: blueprint nvme-volume-driver

Looks like we accidentally added a service we didn't want in Stein
for the ControllerStorageNfs role.

Closes-Bug: 1832748

commit_message:
Expose Hyper-V supported image types

VHD and VHDX are the only image formats currently supported by the
Hyper-V driver.

This change updates the driver capabilities accordingly, which will
then be advertised through traits.

Related to blueprint request-filter-image-types

(cherry-picked from I193a3e32c6d99493fe76608ef0b1b9fe1bbd5422)

Change-Id: If4c8db2d51dbdc85a4d8b6782354a9f68987e7cc

Great update, Adam, thanks. This is good stuff.'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2019-06-13 18:26:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2

I would very mildly have preferred that the first commit be a straight copy of the original spec with additional changes layered on top, just so we could easily tell what came from the spec and what is new.

That said, this all looks fine to me, so meh. Let's go with it."}, {'account_id': 2394, 'date': '2019-06-13 18:32:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

@Ben yeah that was my first instinct too, but then we'd be embedding non-documentation spec stuff in documentation, albeit with the intention of only doing so momentarily, and it felt icky to do that.  My OCD tendencies discourage me from polluting a repo with broken stuff, even briefly :)  A nice way around that would be https://github.com/bennorth/git-dendrify/ but unfortunately Gerrit's one-commit-at-a-time workflow can't support atomic merges of merge commits ..."}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-06-13 19:08:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 17130, 'date': '2019-06-13 22:48:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2019-06-14 10:08:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

That was an excellent spec and this is a great doc. Nicely done'}]

commit_message:
Add logging guidelines based on previous spec

Convert the logging guidelines from the previous cross-project spec:

  https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/openstack-specs/specs/log-guidelines.html

so that they read as documentation rather than a spec, in order to
encourage developers down the right lines.

Also port a section on variable interpolation from oslo.i18n.  It was
misplaced there because it wasn't specific to i18n, and anyway logs
are no longer translated so it had to be removed from there by
Ib86013ff5e7b.

Change-Id: I3b8299b7a53e9e22c507930aa7a37c81ebcd580e

commit_message:
Explicitly set ansible_python_interpreter in external upgrade playbook

During the run of external upgrade playbook, we connect to systems
with different OS releases via delegate_to, which seems to confuse the
autodetection of Python interpreter. Set it explicitly to
platform-python which should work both on EL7 and EL8.

Co-Authored-By: Sergii Golovatiuk <sgolovat@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ieb486f0c3e4de7229cdd2be49d4d0f038668f06d
Closes-Bug: #1830713

get_default_machine_type. The only alteration is to the naming of the
mappings variable that has changed to machine_types to better reflect

commit_message:
fup: Merge machine_type_mappings into get_default_machine_type

As discussed in Id97f4baddcf2caff91599773d9b5de5181b7fdf6
machine_type_mappings only had a single caller and should be merged into
get_default_machine_type.

Change-Id: I29c7a96ca858e8941744b1a931863b908522fc4a

commit_message:
Add undercloud.conf enable_nova option

This can be set to false for underclouds which only use
deployed-server.

Change-Id: Ia1eaec2ed12eb5eb366e8c78b174aff43b447051
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/664174/
Blueprint: nova-less-deploy

commit_message:
Move datasource query_retry into baseclass.

Moves the query_retry method into the baseclass and makes the query
retry and timeout options part of the watcher_datasources config group.
This makes the query_retry behavior uniform across all datasources.

A new baseclass method named query_retry_reset is added so datasources
can define operations to perform when recovering from a query error.
Test cases are added to verify the behavior of query_retry.

The query_max_retries and query_timeout config parameters are
deprecated in the gnocchi_client group and will be removed in a future
release.

Change-Id: I33e9dc2d1f5ba8f83fcf1488ff583ca5be5529cc

commit_message:
Env file to disable undercloud nova

This can optionally be included during undercloud install when nodes
will not be deployed by heat/nova.

Change-Id: I05a52f346f49bf5623e5503bde7105c5de439f9d
Blueprint: nova-less-deploy

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-06-10 18:04:59.000000000', 'message': 'Explicitly disable all MySQL/MariaDB query_cache use

The query_cache in MySQL / MariaDB is generally not recommended,
as it tends to produce more cache misses than hits and adds latency to all
queries.  Upstream MySQL / MariaDB are  moving away from it, MariaDB > 10.1.7
now defaults it to OFF, MySQL has deprecated the entire feature. Ideally
puppet-mysql would default query_cache_type to zero as well. While it is likely
that recent TripleO versions are producing a     MariaDB without a query cache
in any case due to its default of  off, add the values explicitly to avoid
confusion and to  support potential backporting efforts.

References:

https://mariadb.com/kb/en/library/mariadb-memory-allocation/#query-cache
https://mysqlserverteam.com/mysql-8-0-retiring-support-for-the-query-cache/
https://mariadb.com/kb/en/library/mariadb-1017-release-notes/#notable-changes
https://haydenjames.io/mysql-query-cache-size-performance/

Change-Id: Iadee0cbffbb50d20a5e97c8883fd955fa5cb9266
'}]
commit_message:
Explicitly disable all MySQL/MariaDB query_cache use

The query_cache in MySQL / MariaDB is generally not recommended,
as it tends to produce more cache misses than hits and adds latency to all
queries.  Upstream MySQL / MariaDB are  moving away from it, MariaDB > 10.1.7
now defaults it to OFF, MySQL has deprecated the entire feature. Ideally
puppet-mysql would default query_cache_type to zero as well. While it is likely
that recent TripleO versions are producing a     MariaDB without a query cache
in any case due to its default of  off, add the values explicitly to avoid
confusion and to  support potential backporting efforts.

References:

https://mariadb.com/kb/en/library/mariadb-memory-allocation/#query-cache
https://mysqlserverteam.com/mysql-8-0-retiring-support-for-the-query-cache/
https://mariadb.com/kb/en/library/mariadb-1017-release-notes/#notable-changes
https://haydenjames.io/mysql-query-cache-size-performance/

Change-Id: Iadee0cbffbb50d20a5e97c8883fd955fa5cb9266

commit_message:
Temporarily add .yaml extension for all-nodes-deployment-hieradata.j2

Write both paths with and without the .yaml extension until
https://review.opendev.org/#/c/663736 merges. This patch will allow the
tripleo-common patch to merge, then we can come back and clean this up.

Needed-By: I0b3188ef45dc379f83c36561616b422418845b66
Change-Id: I1434da248bb9bc06e38381a47f274e1480fd450c

commit_message:
Add HostnameNetworkConfigMap output

This output will map server names to their NetworkConfig resource id.
This makes it easy to retrieve the NetworkConfig resource for each
server in the config-download code.

Change-Id: I315f2e2eb880e9f3cb67d9f4cdc789f08c6c4021
implements: blueprint reduce-deployment-resources

commit_message:
Use force_refresh=True on network info update

When we need refresh the network info cache on instance deletion, use
force_refresh=True to make sure the info in nova are correctly requested
from neutron.

WIP

Change-Id: I378d272a3745b3a57239c0f27e66a92b4686e75f
Signed-off-by: Arnaud Morin <arnaud.morin@corp.ovh.com>

[{'created': '2019-05-23 13:02:31.000000000', 'message': 'Ansible module: fix configdrive partition creation step

Fix node deployment: failed on configdrive partitioning step on some

[{'created': '2019-06-14 06:38:05.000000000', 'message': "Blacklist bandit 1.6.0

There's a regression[0] in bandit 1.6.0 which causes bandit to stop
respecting excluded directories, and our tests throw a bunch of
violations. Blacklist this version, but allow newer versions as there is
already a pull request[1] to fix it, and I expect it will be included in
the next release.

[0] https://github.com/PyCQA/bandit/issues/488
[1] https://github.com/PyCQA/bandit/pull/489

NOTE(yoctozepto): this fixes also sphinx (python2/3 issue) which is required to unbreak stable/stein

Change-Id: I4429614a57fb512fe2bfdf0686c3eff0adc2a2f4
(cherry picked from commit 683db4ae6c38f91f76ae618797077e128f483168)
"}]
commit_message:
Blacklist bandit 1.6.0

There's a regression[0] in bandit 1.6.0 which causes bandit to stop
respecting excluded directories, and our tests throw a bunch of
violations. Blacklist this version, but allow newer versions as there is
already a pull request[1] to fix it, and I expect it will be included in
the next release.

[0] https://github.com/PyCQA/bandit/issues/488
[1] https://github.com/PyCQA/bandit/pull/489

NOTE(yoctozepto): this fixes also sphinx (python2/3 issue) which is required to unbreak stable/stein

Change-Id: I4429614a57fb512fe2bfdf0686c3eff0adc2a2f4
(cherry picked from commit 683db4ae6c38f91f76ae618797077e128f483168)

commit_message:
Fix stack_name reference

The correct way to get the stack name from a stack object is to use
.stack_name and not ['stack_name']. The current version of this code
will fail since Stack does not have a __getitem__ implementation.

Change-Id: I92420af2ca34f1c66058213cbb1a4403017790d1
Closes-Bug: #1832637

commit_message:
Bring py27 tests back

Since defaulting to py3 our 2.7 jobs have actually ran against python 3
due to basepython not declared on our 27 evironments. This patch will
change that.

Change-Id: I4d97c0577460949e8636e9f26b1d4b60b109f5d1

commit_message:
Backwards compatibility for node parameter

Adds backwards compatibility for node parameter used by strategies. If
the node value is set by the user configuration it will override the
value for compute_node which is the value used by the strategies now.

This change was introduced in: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/656622/
Resolution discussed in the meeting on the 5th of June 2019
https://eavesdrop.openstack.org/meetings/watcher/2019/watcher.2019-06-05-08.00.log.html

Change-Id: Idaea062789a6b169e64f556fecc34cfbaaee5076

commit_message:
Enclose VFS_LIST in double quotes

* It is necessary to enclose it in double quotes. If not, the
environment variable will be empty when sourced.

Change-Id: Ic4e50dec04eee3b4cdb9d790da4af37f39c07b31
Closes-Bug: 1832378

commit_message:
Retiring neutron-lbaas and bump neutron-lib

neutron-lbaas is retired [0], so networking-odl dependencies must be
removed.
Trunk constants were moved to neutron-lib from neutron with [1] from
1.25.0, and were removed from neutron with [2], thus lower-constraints
must point to at least 1.25.0.
To pass the gate fix sphinx requirements for python>3.4

[0] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-May/006158.html
[1] https://review.opendev.org/636989
[2] https://review.opendev.org/649672

Change-Id: I6e709385fefe12123ecab150237956297cc7e09f

commit_message:
[WIP] Add the backup and restore of glance image

Currently, Freezer doesn't support image backup and restore,
It is necessary for us to increase support for image backup and
restore.

Implements: bp Add-support-for-glance-image-backup
Co-authored-by: gengchc2 <geng.changcai2@zte.com.cn>
Change-Id: I2a3ce511aa3c5357799a97babbe3eb0a3818fdfd
Story: #2005855
Task: #33648

commit_message:
Bump the sphinx to 1.6.2 for lower-constraints.txt

1. Package 'sphinx' is constrained to 1.6.5 which does not match the
minimum version specifier 1.6.2 in doc/requirements.txt[0]

[0]: refer to https://github.com/openstack/python-muranoclient/blob/master/doc/requirements.txt#L5

Change-Id: Ia15cc48ce020ff936185d6a94312e68c3c1603b3

commit_message:
Blacklist bandit 1.6.0

There's a regression[0] in bandit 1.6.0 which causes bandit to stop
respecting excluded directories, and our tests throw a bunch of
violations. Blacklist this version, but allow newer versions as there is
already a pull request[1] to fix it, and I expect it will be included in
the next release.

[0] https://github.com/PyCQA/bandit/issues/488
[1] https://github.com/PyCQA/bandit/pull/489

commit_message:
Sync Sphinx requirement

Sync sphinx dependency with global requirements. It caps python 2 since
sphinx 2.0 no longer supports Python 2.7.

This change fixes `requirements-check` Zuul job.

Change-Id: I9c3dff8c0a87d3bad327f83770f8a6f8484abac6
Closes-Bug: #1831410

[{'created': '2019-04-18 13:06:27.000000000', 'message': 'Make allocation failure handling more robust

First, clear allocation node_id before saving the error message
to make sure it does not have a node_id that cannot be saved.

Second, do not log an exception if Allocation is deleted during handling.
This is a normal situation and should not report a traceback.

Change-Id: I497d3aaae91e8aa87649323874121eb6e81c5fd8

'}]
commit_message:
Do not log an exception if Allocation is deleted during handling.

This is a normal situation and should not report a traceback.

Change-Id: I497d3aaae91e8aa87649323874121eb6e81c5fd8

commit_message:
Api-guide: Add Block Device Mapping

Added some descriptions and example about block device mapping in
api-guide, this will help the API user to better understand how to
provide block device mapping information in server request body.

Change-Id: I5a85d7f190f7cda160e1e13805d356a2d4303bf0

commit_message:
Add tempest_install_method for not integrated test

For non integrated test tempest_install_method is not defined,
when python_venv_build tries to launch meta handler.
This pathc is supposed to fix such tests.

Change-Id: I939ac62b0c85110c11e94c31ea7ac175722b14f4

commit_message:
Simplified metrics implementation

If monascastatsd is installed, the current implementation
will always open a socket when starting designate, even if
metrics is disabled in the configuration.

This patch changes this by changing the way the timer was
implemented, making sure that the metrics implemention
is only loaded when needed.

* Made the error message obvious when metrics is disabled,
  and when we are missing the monasca-statsd client.
* Removed support for the timed decorator.

Change-Id: I508269ae3baac9882a51fb61ce55d6169ffddad3

.stack_name and not ['stack_name']. The current version of this code

commit_message:
Fix stack_name reference

The correct way to get the stack name from a stack object is to use
.stack_name and not ['stack_name']. The current version of this code
will fail since Stack does not have a __getitem__ implementation.

Change-Id: I92420af2ca34f1c66058213cbb1a4403017790d1
Closes-Bug: #1832637
(cherry picked from commit e2dd051205e93b63774b1e9214f6b5468cb7a178)

Build failed.  To recheck use 'run-INFINIDAT'.  For 3rd party ci contact info: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/ThirdPartySystems

- dsvm-tempest-infinibox-fc http://openstack-ci-logs.aws.infinidat.com/12/653912/1/check/dsvm-tempest-infinibox-fc/53bdc68 : FAILURE in 55m 27s

* Hedvig-CI http://os-logserver.hedviginc.com/refs/changes/12/653912/1 : FAILURE'}, {'account_id': 7160, 'date': '2019-04-19 12:36:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(3 comments)'}, {'account_id': 26537, 'date': '2019-04-19 13:45:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Build succeeded.

- cinder-iscsi http://cloudbase-ci.com/cinder/653912/1/iscsi/ : SUCCESS in 1h 02m 27s
- cinder-smb http://cloudbase-ci.com/cinder/653912/1/smb/ : SUCCESS in 55m 19s'}, {'account_id': 28801, 'date': '2019-04-19 14:40:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Build failed.

- dsvm-tempest-cisco-zonemanager-job http://173.39.89.136/logs/12/653912/1/check/dsvm-tempest-cisco-zonemanager-job/7b09a8b/ : FAILURE in 1h 03m 48s'}, {'account_id': 4523, 'date': '2019-04-22 14:10:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-2

We should not start passing the force delete flag to drivers.

It is not reasonable to leave it up to the end user whether a volume needs to be deleted with an additional "force" option or not.

Force delete in Cinder is a small feature mostly used to work around various bugs that can be bypassed by changing the volume status check in the API.  It is not intended to be more than this.'}, {'account_id': 7160, 'date': '2019-04-22 16:27:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Eric,
Understand your comment.
so what is the proposal to resolve the bug?
Force delete and regular delete has different behavior.
Thanks,
Arkady'}, {'account_id': 4523, 'date': '2019-04-23 15:57:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I don't know a lot about the details of the VNX driver, but my proposal would be that determination of force_delete_lun_in_sg shouldn't be based on delete/force-delete.  (And it shouldn't be based on a config option either, because there is no reason that I can see that a deployer would want to turn it on or off.)

The behavior around "force delete lun in SG" seems to be something that the driver can determine itself and handle as appropriate.

What are the side effects of enabling it?  (Not specified in the current config option -- which is part of why it's a bad option.)

Can't the driver just call a delete without it, and if the delete_lun fails, add it and call delete_lun again if appropriate?

Trying to push this off to the user via force-delete or an admin via config options means that if there is some downside to doing a delete_lun with this option set, the admin/user will just end up doing it.  If it's a safe operation, the driver can just call it as needed.'}, {'account_id': 7160, 'date': '2019-04-23 19:36:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Thanks Eric.
I think the crooks of the matter is how to deal with luns in a group.
But I will let Hao comment on it.'}, {'account_id': 7160, 'date': '2019-04-23 19:38:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I meant Ryan.'}, {'account_id': 18742, 'date': '2019-04-25 02:25:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> I don't know a lot about the details of the VNX driver, but my
 > proposal would be that determination of force_delete_lun_in_sg
 > shouldn't be based on delete/force-delete.  (And it shouldn't be
 > based on a config option either, because there is no reason that I
 > can see that a deployer would want to turn it on or off.)
 > 
 > The behavior around "force delete lun in SG" seems to be something
 > that the driver can determine itself and handle as appropriate.
 > 
 > What are the side effects of enabling it?  (Not specified in the
 > current config option -- which is part of why it's a bad option.)
 > 
 > Can't the driver just call a delete without it, and if the
 > delete_lun fails, add it and call delete_lun again if appropriate?
 > 
 > Trying to push this off to the user via force-delete or an admin
 > via config options means that if there is some downside to doing a
 > delete_lun with this option set, the admin/user will just end up
 > doing it.  If it's a safe operation, the driver can just call it as
 > needed.

Thanks for your comments, Eric. It makes sense that the driver should always delete the volume. If the driver cannot delete the volume due to its state on VNX, the driver should clear the state before deleting the volume. I'll abandon this review and file another one which would set the default value of the option `force_delete_lun_in_storagegroup` to True.'}, {'account_id': 18742, 'date': '2019-06-14 03:09:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Abandoning this one. The new review is: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/665281/'}, {'account_id': 18742, 'date': '2019-06-14 03:10:02.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

New review is: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/665281/'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-19 06:59:00.000000000', 'message': 'VNX: Accept force deletion of volumes

Users need to set `force_delete_lun_in_storagegroup` to `True` in
`cinder.conf` before to force delete volumes in storage groups. Now they
can use the command `cinder force-delete` or
`openstack volume delete --force` and when any of these two commands is
executed, volumes will be deleted no matter what value is set to option
`force_delete_lun_in_storagegroup`.

Change-Id: I6e3834890cefd0333c7b43933f757757c0263d30
Implements: blueprint pass-force-delete-to-driver
Closes-bug: #1825469
'}]
commit_message:
VNX: Accept force deletion of volumes

Users need to set `force_delete_lun_in_storagegroup` to `True` in
`cinder.conf` before to force delete volumes in storage groups. Now they
can use the command `cinder force-delete` or
`openstack volume delete --force` and when any of these two commands is
executed, volumes will be deleted no matter what value is set to option
`force_delete_lun_in_storagegroup`.

Change-Id: I6e3834890cefd0333c7b43933f757757c0263d30
Implements: blueprint pass-force-delete-to-driver
Closes-bug: #1825469

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-05-31 22:05:16.000000000', 'message': "[ironic] Don't remove instance info twice in destroy

During teardown, at the end of the ironic virt driver's destroy method,
we call _cleanup_deploy, which since
https://review.opendev.org/#/c/563722/ removes instance_info from the
ironic node. Given that we're destroying the node, the instance_info
will have been cleared from the node anyway, so we don't need to do
this.

Further, it can cause tear down to fail if automated cleaning is
enabled in ironic. This happens because ironic prevents updates to nodes
that are undergoing a state transition, as is the case during cleaning.
The virt driver will retry this request by default every 2 seconds with
60 attempts. Typically this is not long enough for cleaning to complete,
so tear down fails with the following error:

  Conflict: Node a00696d5-32ba-475e-9528-59bf11cffea6 can not be updated
  while a state transition is in progress. (HTTP 409)

This change skips the instance info update in _cleanup_deploy in the
case of tear down.

Change-Id: Iea337f73c231db2cb9d9f639b92475daaede6793
Closes-Bug: #1815799
(cherry picked from commit 060e42b7fd185bf3b827b7aa5c9ab6131f6a21d7)
"}, {'created': '2019-06-11 20:46:22.000000000', 'message': "[ironic] Don't remove instance info twice in destroy

During teardown, at the end of the ironic virt driver's destroy method,
we call _cleanup_deploy, which since
https://review.opendev.org/#/c/563722/ removes instance_info from the
ironic node. Given that we're destroying the node, the instance_info
will have been cleared from the node anyway, so we don't need to do
this.

Further, it can cause tear down to fail if automated cleaning is
enabled in ironic. This happens because ironic prevents updates to nodes
that are undergoing a state transition, as is the case during cleaning.
The virt driver will retry this request by default every 2 seconds with
60 attempts. Typically this is not long enough for cleaning to complete,
so tear down fails with the following error:

  Conflict: Node a00696d5-32ba-475e-9528-59bf11cffea6 can not be updated
  while a state transition is in progress. (HTTP 409)

This change skips the instance info update in _cleanup_deploy in the
case of tear down.

Change-Id: Iea337f73c231db2cb9d9f639b92475daaede6793
Closes-Bug: #1815799
(cherry picked from commit 060e42b7fd185bf3b827b7aa5c9ab6131f6a21d7)
(cherry picked from commit 95ace7cf8daf4ff935ff6df877554fdfddef9e4a)
"}]
commit_message:
[ironic] Don't remove instance info twice in destroy

During teardown, at the end of the ironic virt driver's destroy method,
we call _cleanup_deploy, which since
https://review.opendev.org/#/c/563722/ removes instance_info from the
ironic node. Given that we're destroying the node, the instance_info
will have been cleared from the node anyway, so we don't need to do
this.

Further, it can cause tear down to fail if automated cleaning is
enabled in ironic. This happens because ironic prevents updates to nodes
that are undergoing a state transition, as is the case during cleaning.
The virt driver will retry this request by default every 2 seconds with
60 attempts. Typically this is not long enough for cleaning to complete,
so tear down fails with the following error:

  Conflict: Node a00696d5-32ba-475e-9528-59bf11cffea6 can not be updated
  while a state transition is in progress. (HTTP 409)

This change skips the instance info update in _cleanup_deploy in the
case of tear down.

Change-Id: Iea337f73c231db2cb9d9f639b92475daaede6793
Closes-Bug: #1815799
(cherry picked from commit 060e42b7fd185bf3b827b7aa5c9ab6131f6a21d7)
(cherry picked from commit 95ace7cf8daf4ff935ff6df877554fdfddef9e4a)

commit_message:
Corrent using auth_type=none in clouds.yaml

First, we expect the 'auth' dict to never be empty, but it's actually
empty for the none auth type.

Second, we do not respect <service type>_endpoint_override, which are
very handy when used with the none auth type.

This change fixes both.

Change-Id: If05498095da88a85342e994bba9841a304c963a0

subject: Fix quota incorrect caused by deleting instance
messages:
[{'account_id': 8037, 'date': '2017-12-26 06:49:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 22608, 'date': '2017-12-27 01:56:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Hi mimmin,
1. User should't delete a "DELETING" instance.
2. If you want to avoid deleting a "DELETING" instance, you should block the rest DELETING request, rahter than continue delete action with "deltas=0", because at this point, the instance maybe has deleted by the previous delete request.
3. The commit message confused me at first, here are some advise may help you. https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages'}, {'account_id': 8037, 'date': '2017-12-27 03:00:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> Hi mimmin,
 > 1. User should't delete a "DELETING" instance.
User cannot see any "DELETING" status, it's task status and "SHUTDOWN" is user view's instance status.
Delete action may be blocked by any unknown error so that instance task status keep DELETING and resources cannot be removed.
Someone may try to delete  SHUTDOWN instance again and again( blocked logtime)
 > 2. If you want to avoid deleting a "DELETING" instance, you should
 > block the rest DELETING request, rahter than continue delete action
 > with "deltas=0", because at this point, the instance maybe has
 > deleted by the previous delete request.

If force-delete is called, reset-state will be called before delete it, and task status will be changed to None（quota have been reduced）.
When delete is called, quota will be reduced again.

 > 3. The commit message confused me at first, here are some advise
 > may help you. https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages'}, {'account_id': 22608, 'date': '2017-12-27 05:26:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

 > Someone may try to delete  SHUTDOWN instance again and again(
 > blocked logtime)
Delete failed will call QUOTAS.rallback(),it will rollback the deltas. What unknow error you met that block rollback function.
 > > 2. If you want to avoid deleting a "DELETING" instance, you
 > should
 > > block the rest DELETING request, rahter than continue delete

As you said, force-delete will set task_status to be None, So what's the meaning of your change.

 > Delete failed will call QUOTAS.rallback(),it will rollback the

 > As you said, force-delete will set task_status to be None, So
 > what's the meaning of your change.
 > > > 3. The commit message confused me at first, here are some
 > advise
 > > > may help you. https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages

1. Quota rollback is only in trove-api, any error in trove-taskmanager won't cause rollback

2. The instances is deleted but blocked by some error so that the SHUTDOWN status is kept for long time and quota have been reduced. 
Anyone may try to delete it again, right?
User may use force-delete instance.
Force-delete = reset-state firstly, then delete.
Current implementation: reset-state set task status from "Deleting" -> None.
when delete(second time, third ...) is called, how do identify the instance which have been deleted? Any flag without task status cloud help to find the instance is deleting?'}, {'account_id': 22608, 'date': '2017-12-28 04:32:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

1. Quota rollback is only in trove-api, any error in trove-taskmanager won't cause rollback
2. The instances is deleted but blocked by some error so that the SHUTDOWN status is kept for long time and quota have been reduced. 
Anyone may try to delete it again, right?
User may use force-delete instance.
Force-delete = reset-state firstly, then delete.
Current implementation: reset-state set task status from "Deleting" -> None.
when delete(second time, third ...) is called, how do identify the instance which have been deleted? Any flag without task status cloud help to find the instance is deleting?

Could you share us the error message when the instance block at task_status=DELETING". According the code, 
https://github.com/openstack/trove/blob/master/trove/instance/models.py#L661
after `self._delete_resources(deleted_at)`, will call `update_db` to set task_status to None and deleted=1. And `_delete_resource()` handle almost all exception to make sure `update_db` in `delete_sync` can be called.
https://github.com/openstack/trove/blob/master/trove/taskmanager/models.py#L411
https://github.com/openstack/trove/blob/master/trove/taskmanager/models.py#L1035
Even though there is some exception miss handle, in my opinion, the right way is handle it to let the delete action finished. Then, for end user, the instance has been deleted, for developer, there is enough log message to fix it.'}, {'account_id': 22608, 'date': '2017-12-28 04:37:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

|when delete(second time, third ...) is called, how do identify the instance which have been deleted? Any flag without task status cloud help to find the instance is deleting?

That't what I want to say, there is no flag, so we should handle exception to make sure "delete instance" is successfully for enduser, maybe the compute resource or volume resource failed to delete, the instance record should be deleted.'}, {'account_id': 22608, 'date': '2017-12-28 04:50:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

 > task_status=DELETING". According the code,
 > https://github.com/openstack/trove/blob/master/trove/instance/models.py#L661
 > after `self._delete_resources(deleted_at)`, will call `update_db`
 > to set task_status to None and deleted=1. And `_delete_resource()`
 > handle almost all exception to make sure `update_db` in

 > https://github.com/openstack/trove/blob/master/trove/taskmanager/models.py#L411

 > Even though there is some exception miss handle, in my opinion, the
 > right way is handle it to let the delete action finished. Then, for

A little correction： let the "delete action" finish means either set "delete=1 and task_status=None" or change the status of instance like "delete_failed" to tell use what happens.'}, {'account_id': 8037, 'date': '2019-06-14 02:40:44.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
Fix quota incorrect caused by deleting instance

Deleting instance status is set to SHUTDOWN and
quota have been reduced. However, the SHUTDOWN instance
cloud be deleted more than once.

Change-Id: Ia76520933d81067a6e7c1b0750021fb2401e50f8

commit_message:
Update integration requirements

intergration image build requirements too old to trove-guest failed.
The guestagent rpc.py use newer oslo.messaging version(>=5.24.2)[1]
The versions of oslo.* should be updated.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/471635/

Change-Id: Ib93f10459102926fe90bfb64ffd858ac555f86c4

subject: Fix restart_required is automatically changed
messages:
[{'account_id': 8037, 'date': '2017-12-21 10:28:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 22608, 'date': '2017-12-22 03:41:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

1. A create operation should not end as RESTART_REQUIRED status, the last operation will start the db, the status should be ACTIVE enventually.
https://github.com/openstack/trove/blob/master/trove/guestagent/datastore/experimental/postgresql/manager.py#L240'}, {'account_id': 8037, 'date': '2017-12-22 05:15:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> 1. A create operation should not end as RESTART_REQUIRED status,
 > the last operation will start the db, the status should be ACTIVE
 > enventually.
 > https://github.com/openstack/trove/blob/master/trove/guestagent/datastore/experimental/postgresql/manager.py#L240

Thanks for your review. 
The restart_required status isn't caused by prepare stage, it's caused by guest log enable action. The restart action should be executed by instance owner, not change status only.
More details in the bug #1739588."}, {'account_id': 22608, 'date': '2017-12-22 06:43:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: -Code-Review

(2 comments)

> > 1. A create operation should not end as RESTART_REQUIRED status,
 > > the last operation will start the db, the status should be ACTIVE
 > > enventually.
 > > https://github.com/openstack/trove/blob/master/trove/guestagent/datastore/experimental/postgresql/manager.py#L240
 > 
 > Thanks for your review.
 > The restart_required status isn't caused by prepare stage, it's
 > caused by guest log enable action. The restart action should be
 > executed by instance owner, not change status only.
 > More details in the bug #1739588.

OK, I understand now.  besides, add some comments"}, {'account_id': 8037, 'date': '2017-12-26 07:06:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 13157, 'date': '2018-01-17 06:44:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I think this may not be a complete solution for the problem, as many other instance acctions will change the guestagent datastore service status (e.g. do reset-status to the instance, or if attaching replica to mysql instance failed, status will be set to ServiceStatuses.FAILED).

The root cause must be the design of the restart_required status of guestagent datastore service:
1. this status is set when enable/disable log requires datastore restarting, and the log status also is set to restart_required;
2. when the restart of the datastore manager is called, these status will be changed, and the restart method is only called from the client;
3. so this status should be identical to the restart_required task status the trove instance object (trove/instance/tasks.py: InstanceTasks.RESTART_REQUIRED), means there is a task need the user to finish;
4. but by the current implement, this status is a InstanceServiceStatus, whick is maintained mainly by guestagent, and transient.

For the above reason, we may need to change the current guest log restart_required implement:
A. add a new method to the condutor, ask it to update the instance task status;
or
B. guest_log_action from api is a synchronous rpc call, then we could return the required_restart flag from guestagent directly to the api, and update the instance task status.

For both options, the current RESTART_REQUIRED guestagent datastore service status will not be used anymore.'}, {'account_id': 8037, 'date': '2018-01-17 07:15:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> I think this may not be a complete solution for the problem, as
 > many other instance acctions will change the guestagent datastore
 > service status (e.g. do reset-status to the instance, or if
 > attaching replica to mysql instance failed, status will be set to
 > ServiceStatuses.FAILED).
 > 
 > The root cause must be the design of the restart_required status of
 > guestagent datastore service:
 > 1. this status is set when enable/disable log requires datastore
 > restarting, and the log status also is set to restart_required;
 > 2. when the restart of the datastore manager is called, these
 > status will be changed, and the restart method is only called from
 > the client;
 > 3. so this status should be identical to the restart_required task
 > status the trove instance object (trove/instance/tasks.py:
 > InstanceTasks.RESTART_REQUIRED), means there is a task need the
 > user to finish;
 > 4. but by the current implement, this status is a InstanceServiceStatus,
 > whick is maintained mainly by guestagent, and transient.
 > 
 > For the above reason, we may need to change the current guest log
 > restart_required implement:
 > A. add a new method to the condutor, ask it to update the instance
 > task status;
 > or
 > B. guest_log_action from api is a synchronous rpc call, then we
 > could return the required_restart flag from guestagent directly to
 > the api, and update the instance task status.
 > 
 > For both options, the current RESTART_REQUIRED guestagent datastore
 > service status will not be used anymore.

 > I think this may not be a complete solution for the problem, as
 > many other instance acctions will change the guestagent datastore
 > service status (e.g. do reset-status to the instance, or if
 > attaching replica to mysql instance failed, status will be set to
 > ServiceStatuses.FAILED).
 > 
 > The root cause must be the design of the restart_required status of
 > guestagent datastore service:
 > 1. this status is set when enable/disable log requires datastore
 > restarting, and the log status also is set to restart_required;
 > 2. when the restart of the datastore manager is called, these
 > status will be changed, and the restart method is only called from
 > the client;
 > 3. so this status should be identical to the restart_required task
 > status the trove instance object (trove/instance/tasks.py:
 > InstanceTasks.RESTART_REQUIRED), means there is a task need the
 > user to finish;
 > 4. but by the current implement, this status is a InstanceServiceStatus,
 > whick is maintained mainly by guestagent, and transient.
 > 
 > For the above reason, we may need to change the current guest log
 > restart_required implement:
 > A. add a new method to the condutor, ask it to update the instance
 > task status;
 > or
 > B. guest_log_action from api is a synchronous rpc call, then we
 > could return the required_restart flag from guestagent directly to
 > the api, and update the instance task status.
 > 
 > For both options, the current RESTART_REQUIRED guestagent datastore
 > service status will not be used anymore.

 RESTART_REQUIRED is status to notify owner that the instance should be restarted firstly. For database services, some changeset or action must be restart database service to make it work.

If status is changed to ACTIVE(or any other status) without restart action, some wrong maybe happen.

RESTART_REQUIRED status should be changed to database actual status(ACTIVE or other status eg. FAILED) util client/api execute restart action.

NOTE: There is periodic task to update status with actual database service.'}, {'account_id': 24739, 'date': '2018-01-17 15:48:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 24791, 'date': '2018-02-05 21:05:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

Please move those if-conditions to some helper function.'}, {'account_id': 8037, 'date': '2019-06-14 02:39:57.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-21 10:28:51.000000000', 'message': 'Fix restart_required is automatically changed

Restart_required status should not be changed
in update actual db status periodic task.

Change-Id: I5d3e3b1713f414065fa5a99828e1f3cf4c8a3974
Closes-bug: #1739588
'}]
commit_message:
Fix restart_required is automatically changed

Restart_required status should not be changed
in update actual db status periodic task.

Change-Id: I5d3e3b1713f414065fa5a99828e1f3cf4c8a3974
Closes-bug: #1739588

commit_message:
Account/Container quotas should allow object re-upload

Account/container quotas should pass the object re-upload

Change-Id: Ib0ac5fc1e9a71f2ae9017495c3b8775fd55bfd73
Closes-bug: #1530844

subject: Add quota details output for 413 Upload exceeds quota

[{'created': '2019-06-03 21:28:20.000000000', 'message': 'Move the _tag module from OSC to osc-lib

The neutron code in the OpenStack Client(OSC) includes a module
for handling tags[1]. This module is useful for other projects that
support API tags like neutron does.

This is a lift and shift of the _tag.py from the neutron code
in OSC to the osc-lib so that other projects can use it.
In the process I added doc strings and unit test coverage.

A follow on patch will switch the neutron code to use the
module from osc-lib.

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/python-openstackclient/src/ \
    branch/master/openstackclient/network/v2/_tag.py

Change-Id: Icdfdcf3a3ed657d92766081e138733ff43f47f38
'}]
commit_message:
Move the _tag module from OSC to osc-lib

The neutron code in the OpenStack Client(OSC) includes a module
for handling tags[1]. This module is useful for other projects that
support API tags like neutron does.

This is a lift and shift of the _tag.py from the neutron code
in OSC to the osc-lib so that other projects can use it.
In the process I added doc strings and unit test coverage.

A follow on patch will switch the neutron code to use the
module from osc-lib.

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/python-openstackclient/src/ \
    branch/master/openstackclient/network/v2/_tag.py

Change-Id: Icdfdcf3a3ed657d92766081e138733ff43f47f38

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-05-29 20:44:42.000000000', 'message': "Optimize NovaHelper.get_compute_node_by_hostname

The get_compute_node_by_hostname method is given a
compute service hostname and then does two queries to
find the matching hypervisor (compute node) with details:

1. List hypervisors with details and find the one that
   matches the given compute service hostname.

2. Using that node, search for hypervisors with the
   matching hypervisor_hostname.

There are two issues here:

1. The first query is inefficient in that it has to list
   all hypervisors in the deployment to try and match the
   one with the compute service hostname client side.

2. The second query is a fuzzy match on the server side [1]
   so even though we have matched on the node we want,
   get_compute_node_by_name can still return more than
   one hypervisor which will result in the helper method
   raising ComputeNodeNotFound. Consider having compute
   hosts with names compute1, compute10, compute11, compute100,
   and so on. The fuzzy match on compute1 would return all of
   those hypervisors.

For non-ironic nodes in nova, the compute service host and
hypervisor should be 1:1, meaning the hypervisor.service['host']
should be the same as hypervisor.hypervisor_hostname. Knowing
this, we can simplify the code to search just on the given
compute service hostname and if we get more than one result, it
is because of the fuzzy match and we can then do our client-side
filtering on the compute service hostname.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/d4f58f5eb/nova/db/sqlalchemy/api.py#L676

Change-Id: I84f387982f665d7cc11bffe8ec390cc7e7ed5278
"}, {'created': '2019-06-03 16:30:32.000000000', 'message': "Optimize NovaHelper.get_compute_node_by_hostname

The get_compute_node_by_hostname method is given a
compute service hostname and then does two queries to
find the matching hypervisor (compute node) with details:

1. List hypervisors with details and find the one that
   matches the given compute service hostname.

2. Using that node, search for hypervisors with the
   matching hypervisor_hostname.

There are two issues here:

1. The first query is inefficient in that it has to list
   all hypervisors in the deployment to try and match the
   one with the compute service hostname client side.

2. The second query is a fuzzy match on the server side [1]
   so even though we have matched on the node we want,
   get_compute_node_by_name can still return more than
   one hypervisor which will result in the helper method
   raising ComputeNodeNotFound. Consider having compute
   hosts with names compute1, compute10, compute11, compute100,
   and so on. The fuzzy match on compute1 would return all of
   those hypervisors.

For non-ironic nodes in nova, the compute service host and
hypervisor should be 1:1, meaning the hypervisor.service['host']
should be the same as hypervisor.hypervisor_hostname. Knowing
this, we can simplify the code to search just on the given
compute service hostname and if we get more than one result, it
is because of the fuzzy match and we can then do our client-side
filtering on the compute service hostname.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/d4f58f5eb/nova/db/sqlalchemy/api.py#L676

Change-Id: I84f387982f665d7cc11bffe8ec390cc7e7ed5278
"}]
commit_message:
Optimize NovaHelper.get_compute_node_by_hostname

The get_compute_node_by_hostname method is given a
compute service hostname and then does two queries to
find the matching hypervisor (compute node) with details:

1. List hypervisors with details and find the one that
   matches the given compute service hostname.

2. Using that node, search for hypervisors with the
   matching hypervisor_hostname.

There are two issues here:

1. The first query is inefficient in that it has to list
   all hypervisors in the deployment to try and match the
   one with the compute service hostname client side.

2. The second query is a fuzzy match on the server side [1]
   so even though we have matched on the node we want,
   get_compute_node_by_name can still return more than
   one hypervisor which will result in the helper method
   raising ComputeNodeNotFound. Consider having compute
   hosts with names compute1, compute10, compute11, compute100,
   and so on. The fuzzy match on compute1 would return all of
   those hypervisors.

For non-ironic nodes in nova, the compute service host and
hypervisor should be 1:1, meaning the hypervisor.service['host']
should be the same as hypervisor.hypervisor_hostname. Knowing
this, we can simplify the code to search just on the given
compute service hostname and if we get more than one result, it
is because of the fuzzy match and we can then do our client-side
filtering on the compute service hostname.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/d4f58f5eb/nova/db/sqlalchemy/api.py#L676

Change-Id: I84f387982f665d7cc11bffe8ec390cc7e7ed5278

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-06-12 23:02:49.000000000', 'message': 'Fix RedisVirtualIP when overrdiing InternalApi name_lower

When overriding RedisVirtualIP name_lower and using the
service_net_map_replace the overridden name_lower is was
not used in VipSubnetMapDefaults.

Get name_lower from the _service_nets jinja2 variable
which holds the replaced name_lower for the network when
service_net_map_replace is used.

Closes-Bug: #1832461
Change-Id: I839474dcce749fc3a75ae0e1be16780ddb83f5b3
(cherry picked from commit 2bd0012a6e1fc0decad9522ab1d50491f991cbe1)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix RedisVirtualIP when overrdiing InternalApi name_lower

When overriding RedisVirtualIP name_lower and using the
service_net_map_replace the overridden name_lower is was
not used in VipSubnetMapDefaults.

Get name_lower from the _service_nets jinja2 variable
which holds the replaced name_lower for the network when
service_net_map_replace is used.

Closes-Bug: #1832461
Change-Id: I839474dcce749fc3a75ae0e1be16780ddb83f5b3
(cherry picked from commit 2bd0012a6e1fc0decad9522ab1d50491f991cbe1)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-06-13 14:30:52.000000000', 'message': 'update sphinxcontrib-datatemplates to avoid build warnings

Update the dependency on sphinxcontrib.datatemplates to be
sphinxcontrib-datatemplates>=0.4.0 to ensure the new version
installs (I have no idea why the - works but . does not, thanks pip!)
so we have the new directives and can remove the use of the deprecated
directive form.

Change-Id: Icf3f15111254fc37f0843f84b001f054d7c8fcbf
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
update sphinxcontrib-datatemplates to avoid build warnings

Update the dependency on sphinxcontrib.datatemplates to be
sphinxcontrib-datatemplates>=0.4.0 to ensure the new version
installs (I have no idea why the - works but . does not, thanks pip!)
so we have the new directives and can remove the use of the deprecated
directive form.

Change-Id: Icf3f15111254fc37f0843f84b001f054d7c8fcbf
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Freezer: Add timezone access inside container

apscheduler used by freezer-scheduler needs a timezone configured
This change allows container to use the timezone of the host.

deprecated since rocky. I think it's time remove it.

commit_message:
Dont run puppet 4 unit on master

Was deprecated in Stein so we continue to run them
there but for Train it's not supported so removing
testing on master.

Change-Id: I062c7e21fa8a2aa35fbf8768c752715868da5132

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-06-12 23:37:00.000000000', 'message': 'update comment on ignore_basepython_conflict

the current comment implies that setting
ignore_basepython_conflict simply silences
the warning emitted if the base python version
set in the gloabl [testenv] section conflicts
with the automatic python version selected form the
test env name .e.g. py27

this is not correct as the upstream documentation
states setting ignore_basepython_conflict=true
allow enforcing this rule that py37 implies python3.7
however when its is not set basepython from [testenv]
override the implied version form the env name.

https://tox.readthedocs.io/en/latest/config.html#conf-ignore_basepython_conflict

This change updates the comment to reflect that.

Change-Id: Ieab65a2a9c6309021d5ee91e56ac07889a9e9bc4
Related-Bug: #1832652
'}]
commit_message:
update comment on ignore_basepython_conflict

the current comment implies that setting
ignore_basepython_conflict simply silences
the warning emitted if the base python version
set in the gloabl [testenv] section conflicts
with the automatic python version selected form the
test env name .e.g. py27

this is not correct as the upstream documentation
states setting ignore_basepython_conflict=true
allow enforcing this rule that py37 implies python3.7
however when its is not set basepython from [testenv]
override the implied version form the env name.

https://tox.readthedocs.io/en/latest/config.html#conf-ignore_basepython_conflict

This change updates the comment to reflect that.

Change-Id: Ieab65a2a9c6309021d5ee91e56ac07889a9e9bc4
Related-Bug: #1832652

commit_message:
Make netns_wrapper to be compatible with python3

netns_wrapper is using map() function when running command and this
returns map object instead of list in python 3. This patch fixes it
to return list object always.

Change-Id: I22ddde78f2d8af042789e52ea82ec3e8099f7888

commit_message:
Dropping support of 42.3

42.3 will not be maintained anymore and therefore
there is no reason to test it. Users are advised
to upgrade to Leap 15, and we should do the same.

This is a re-implementation of
https://review.opendev.org/#/c/664654/.

Change-Id: I85ea2be5559af2fb47df34ebf13bfc6aada1f9b3

commit_message:
Fix log owner on computes during overcloud deploy runs

[1] switched to run nova-manage discovery as non root user. In case of
updates there can be already a nove-manage log owned by root from previous
runs. This change make sure we change the owner of nova-manage log to
nova:nova on overcloud deploy runs on the computes

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/652039/13/deployment/nova/nova-compute-container-puppet.yaml

Closes-Bug: #1832482

Conflicts:
	deployment/nova/nova-compute-container-puppet.yaml

Change-Id: Ie6d3f5262f7eb20ef92b07f2f359d88cb77b8752

(cherry picked from commit d574fddb1425c9e8166863bf1bc832690be66270)

commit_message:
Sync 'validations/check-network-gateway.yaml' with the new role

To be able to maintain stable branches, the validations in the 'validations'
directory have to be synchronized with the new role created with the
validation framework.

This patch synchronizes the check-network-gateway validation.

Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit c025666cee8b94f14fd795d51c1113803fb42848)
(cherry picked from commit I7bb40a1f0b42cbbf5b38a3939db9140b602e5c52)

Change-Id: I7bb40a1f0b42cbbf5b38a3939db9140b602e5c52

commit_message:
Fix log owner on computes during overcloud deploy runs

[1] switched to run nova-manage discovery as non root user. In case of
updates there can be already a nove-manage log owned by root from previous
runs. This change make sure we change the owner of nova-manage log to
nova:nova on overcloud deploy runs on the computes

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/652039/13/deployment/nova/nova-compute-container-puppet.yaml

Closes-Bug: #1832482

Conflicts:
	deployment/nova/nova-compute-container-puppet.yaml

Change-Id: Ie6d3f5262f7eb20ef92b07f2f359d88cb77b8752
(cherry picked from commit ccabc8f8e68c12321b98e4ada12c005d61b724a1)
(cherry picked from commit 1d02e964db7ed7864f9ec13338c39057f82c95dd)

Service templates like mysql-pacemaker-puppet.yaml pull fresh
container images in step 2 of the upgrade tasks. In case they come
from an allowed insecure registry, the insecure registries setting
must be in place by step 1. We do just that by reusing the "install

commit_message:
Configure insecure registries before Pacemaker-managed image pulls

Service templates like mysql-pacemaker-puppet.yaml pull fresh
container images in step 2 of the upgrade tasks. In case they come
from an allowed insecure registry, the insecure registries setting
must be in place by step 1. We do just that by reusing the "install
and configure Podman" part of host_prep_tasks.

Change-Id: I36e003c09d7f7768da475d166a20f01347a2934c
Partial-Bug: #1831690

commit_message:
Update LXC container config options

OpenSUSE Leap 15.0 now ships with lxc 3.1 which changed two config
options:

1. lxc.kmsg was removed
2. lxc.pts was renamed to lxc.pty.max

This change updates these two options in the container config.

Change-Id: I7b4c657e9216b5e3926672b76cb370256b98ce3c
Depends-On: I8a94f340b8866f3369cebb5950dea873f5d2fece
Signed-off-by: Nicolas Bock <nicolas.bock@suse.com>

commit_message:
Add glance_store tips to experimental jobs

For those times when a change has been made to glance_store master
and we're too impatient to wait until the periodic jobs have run to
see what effect the change has on glance.

Change-Id: I1c99395b4f2424f3f31922f91b1bff3d952ad8db
Closes-bug: #1831996

messages:
[{'account_id': 16708, 'date': '2019-05-22 16:45:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2019-05-23 05:09:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Basically re-stating what I said on IRC, and then rambling on a bit.

Looking at: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/CrossProjectLiaisons#Release_management

we have projects that have multiple liaisons (oslo. nova) so I think we want to make this a list and I like the idea of using the same schema as the ptl record in projects.yaml

so something like:

 liaisons:
  - name: One
    email:
    irc:
  - name: Two
    email:
    irc:

Having said all that I'm starting to have a doubt  I think what we're trying to do is enforce a structure on the information to make it easier to reason about and then use in tools (like auto-CCing liaisons when we upload a change for $team.  This is a good goal but I winder if adding it per series/per deliverable is the right thing to do?

fast forward 2 cycles we could end up with different liaisons for $project on train, U and v? Or will we enforce changes to all deliverables?

Does it make sense to just create a deliverables/liasions.yaml keyed by team

$team:
 liaisons:
  - name:
    email:
    irc:

That gives us the advantages lets us trivially find liaisons and CC them, but more closely matches the use-case for the wiki?"}, {'account_id': 16708, 'date': '2019-05-30 20:21:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2019-05-31 12:25:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)

The list-changes job is failing because this new YAML file is being treated as a deliverable file. We had to add an exclusion for series_status.yaml and I think we'll need one for this new file, too. You could either modify https://opendev.org/openstack/releases/src/branch/master/openstack_releases/gitutils.py#L41 to look for the new name, or do something more clever by renaming both files .yml and excluding all files with that extension."}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2019-06-03 14:53:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

commit_message:
Add Liaisons to Deliverables File

Adding liaisons to deliverables where there is a liasion listed here:
https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/CrossProjectLiaisons#Release_management

Also creates a data dir to put the non deliverable files that were in the
deliverables dir elsewhere and updates filepaths to reflect the change.

Story: 2005702
Task: 31024

Change-Id: Idc5f4b29dd375465b21d678fa8503cbd8d6d3eb6

commit_message:
Include all network devices in nova diagnostics

get_instance_diagnostics expected all interfaces
to have a <target> element with a "dev" attribute in
the instance XML. This is not the case for VFIO
interfaces (<interface type="hostdev">).
This caused an IndexError when looping over
the interfaces.

This patch fixes this issue by retrieving interfaces
data directly from the guest XML and adding nics
appropriately to the diagnostics object.

The new functional test has been left out of this
cherry-pick, since a lot of the test code that
supports the test is missing and would have to be
back-ported just for that one test, including a
ramification of other commit dependencies.
The functional code change itself is rather simple,
and not having this functional test present in
Rocky is considered to be low risk.

Change-Id: I8ef852d449e9e637d45e4ac92ffc5d1abd8d31c5
Closes-Bug: #1821798
(cherry picked from commit 1d4f64b190afc60b0c2a56de718209869c41cfb3)

commit_message:
docs: Don't version links to reno docs

reno doesn't have stable branches and doesn't version its documentation.
There's no point versioning our links to same.

Conflicts:
	doc/source/conf.py

NOTE(stephenfin): Conflict is because there are no links to the TripleO
docs here so the comment I modified on previous branches doesn't exist
here. We also have to modify the 'contributor/placement.rst' document
since that has been removed on master as part of the placement
extraction.

Change-Id: Id782d3b11715bc3211e7952fb01b42a659d06e36
Closes-Bug: #1830926
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 8b9dad0b636e4f6bdd8e1eee0f1a8a00c1ffd2b7)
(cherry picked from commit dc7eb62c27dca29731c46fed531de3ce36b49308)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-06-04 11:27:50.000000000', 'message': 'DNM/WIP blockinfo: Use SATA bus for cdrom devices when using q35

Closes-bug: 1831538
Change-Id: Id97f4baddcf2caff91599773d9b5de5181b7fdf6
'}, {'created': '2019-06-04 16:10:23.000000000', 'message': "libvirt: Use SATA bus for cdrom devices when using q35 machine type

The q35 machine type no longer provides an IDE bus and will need to use
a SATA bus to attach legacy devices such as cdroms. More details can be
found in the following related bug:

Don't assume the guest machine type to be of 'pc'
https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1780138

To enable this the _get_machine_type method is extracted from the Libvirt
driver into the utility module. This allows the method to be reused by
the blockinfo module so a simple lookup can be preformed to determine if
the q35 machine type will be used by the instance while looking up disk
mapping information.

Additionally the signature of _get_machine_type is changed to
accommodate the passing of LibvirtDriver._host and optionally host
capabilities so we can lookup the underlying hosts CPU arch. This
unfortunately results in a large amount of unavoidable test file damage.

Related-bug: 1780138
Closes-bug: 1831538
Change-Id: Id97f4baddcf2caff91599773d9b5de5181b7fdf6
"}, {'created': '2019-06-04 18:30:18.000000000', 'message': "libvirt: Use SATA bus for cdrom devices when using q35 machine type

The q35 machine type no longer provides an IDE bus and will need to use
a SATA bus to attach legacy devices such as cdroms. More details can be
found in the following related bug:

Don't assume the guest machine type to be of 'pc'
https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1780138

To enable this the _get_machine_type method is extracted from the
Libvirt driver into the utility module. This allows the method to be
reused by the blockinfo module so a lookup can be preformed to determine
if the q35 machine type will be used by the instance while looking up
disk mapping information.

The signature of _get_disk_bus_for_device_type has changed to
accommodate the passing of LibvirtDriver._host. This allows the host
capabilities to be passed to the extracted get_machine_type method. This
unfortunately results in a large amount of unavoidable test file damage.

Related-bug: 1780138
Closes-bug: 1831538
Change-Id: Id97f4baddcf2caff91599773d9b5de5181b7fdf6
"}, {'created': '2019-06-04 18:40:39.000000000', 'message': "libvirt: Use SATA bus for cdrom devices when using q35 machine type

a SATA bus to attach legacy devices such as cdroms. More details can be
found in the following related bug:

Don't assume the guest machine type to be of 'pc'
https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1780138

To enable this the _get_machine_type method is extracted from the
Libvirt driver into the utility module. This allows the method to be
reused by the blockinfo module so a lookup can be preformed to determine
if the q35 machine type will be used by the instance while looking up

The signature of _get_disk_bus_for_device_type has changed to
accommodate the passing of LibvirtDriver._host. This allows the host
capabilities to be passed to the extracted get_machine_type method. This
unfortunately results in a large amount of unavoidable test file damage
as LibvirtDriver._host also needs to be passed around via
get_info_from_bdm, get_root_info, default_device_names, get_disk_mapping
and get_disk_info.

Related-bug: 1780138
Closes-bug: 1831538
Change-Id: Id97f4baddcf2caff91599773d9b5de5181b7fdf6

The Q35 machine type no longer provides an IDE bus and will need to use
a SATA bus to attach legacy devices such as cdroms. More details can be
found in the following related bug:

Don't assume the guest machine type to be of 'pc'
https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1780138

To enable this the _get_machine_type method is extracted from the
Libvirt driver into the utility module. This allows the method to be

"}, {'created': '2019-06-07 15:44:09.000000000', 'message': 'libvirt: Use SATA bus for cdrom devices when using Q35 machine type

The Q35 machine type no longer provides an IDE bus and will need to use
a SATA bus to attach legacy devices such as cdroms. More details can be
found in the following related bug:

Don't assume the guest machine type to be of 'pc'
https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1780138

This change now ensures the blockinfo.get_disk_bus_for_device_type
method will now return "sata" as the bus type when the Q35 machine type
is used for cdrom devices on QEMU or KVM hosts that are not PPC, S390 or
AArch64 based.

To enable this the _get_machine_type method has been extracted from the
Libvirt driver into the Libvirt utils module. This method has also been
simplified through the removal of the caps parameter, replaced with
calls to the get_arch utility method and additional extraction of
architecture specific defaults into the existing
get_default_machine_type utility method.

Related-bug: 1780138
Closes-bug: 1831538
Change-Id: Id97f4baddcf2caff91599773d9b5de5181b7fdf6

commit_message:
libvirt: Use SATA bus for cdrom devices when using Q35 machine type

The Q35 machine type no longer provides an IDE bus and will need to use
a SATA bus to attach legacy devices such as cdroms. More details can be
found in the following related bug:

Don't assume the guest machine type to be of 'pc'
https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1780138

This change now ensures the blockinfo.get_disk_bus_for_device_type
method will now return "sata" as the bus type when the Q35 machine type
is used for cdrom devices on QEMU or KVM hosts that are not PPC, S390 or
AArch64 based.

To enable this the _get_machine_type method has been extracted from the
Libvirt driver into the Libvirt utils module. This method has also been
simplified through the removal of the caps parameter, replaced with
calls to the get_arch utility method and additional extraction of
architecture specific defaults into the existing
get_default_machine_type utility method.

Related-bug: 1780138
Closes-bug: 1831538
Change-Id: Id97f4baddcf2caff91599773d9b5de5181b7fdf6

commit_message:
Allow driver to properly unplug VIFs on destination on confirm resize

Update PCI related VIFs with the original PCI address on the source
host to allow the virt driver to properly unplug VIFs from
hypervisor, e.g allow the proper VF representor to be unplugged
from the integration bridge in case of a hardware offloaded OVS.

While other approaches are possible for solving the issue,
The approach proposed in the series allows the fix to be safely
backported.

Closes-Bug: #1809095

Conflicts in unit tests were trivial to solve
no changes in test logic.

Conflicts:
    nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute.py
    nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute_mgr.py

Change-Id: Id3c4d839fb1a6da47cfb366b65c0904d281a218f
(cherry picked from commit 77a339c4e8d51de82cd6c4530b8473cc8bb6aea8)

commit_message:
Move get_pci_mapping_for_migration to MigrationContext

In order to fix Bug #1809095, it is required to update
PCI related VIFs with the original PCI address on the source
host to allow virt driver to properly unplug the VIF from hypervisor,
e.g allow the proper VF representor to be unplugged
from the integration bridge in case of a hardware offloaded OVS.

To do so, some preliminary work is needed to allow code-sharing
between nova.network.neutronv2 and nova.compute.manager

This change:
- Moves common logic to retrieve the PCI mapping between
  the source and destination node from nova.network.neutronv2
  to objects.migration_context.
- Makes code adjustments to methods in nova.network.neutronv2
  to accomodate the former.

Partial-Bug: #1809095

Conflicts:
    nova/network/neutronv2/api.py

Change-Id: I9a5118373548c525b2b1c2271e7d210cc92e4f4c
(cherry picked from commit 84bb00a86da539183211364961ada2c1b1bb5edc)

commit_message:
Ensure tunnel types are absent if not configured

This patch fixes a bug where updating a configuration wouldn't remove
agent/tunnel_types configuration when required.

Change-Id: I8248ad80e6ff88aec252919fa687018bda78a60b
Closes-Bug: #1832251

messages:
[{'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2018-11-15 14:35:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 4264, 'date': '2018-11-15 15:18:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thanks for putting this up.

Tox is currently unhappy because:

deliverables/stein/collectd-openstack-plugins.yaml: 'independent' is not one of ['cycle-with-intermediary', 'cycle-with-milestones', 'cycle-trailing', 'untagged', 'cycle-with-rc']"}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2018-11-15 17:54:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

it is not but is is one of the valid release models

https://github.com/openstack/releases/blob/master/doc/source/reference/release_models.rst#independent

i could change it to cycle-trailing.
https://github.com/openstack/releases/blob/master/doc/source/reference/release_models.rst#cycle-trailing

originally we inteded to do a release once a cycle but
it usually happend after the rc phase and  was not always tagged.

the main consumer of this project has been opnfv which and intel onp program both of which previous wanted specific commits instead of timed releases.


untagged would also work but we should actually tag the releaes
https://github.com/openstack/releases/blob/master/doc/source/reference/release_models.rst#untagged


ill chat to the release team on irc and see what they recommend'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2018-11-15 21:45:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2018-11-15 21:51:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

this is still going to fail.
i will need to split this into several patches.

it look like i did the previous releases by hand rather then using the automated release infrastructure to do it.

as such i will need to create the release jobs so that zuul can publish to pypi. 

alternitivly i can do the release the old way by manyaly tagging however to do that i will need to resetup may gpg keys and push signed tags followed by manually pushing the sdist packages to pypi.
i can do this if needed but i would prefer to set up the automated jobs for the repo to make this simpler going forward'}, {'account_id': 4264, 'date': '2018-11-16 09:54:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Thanks again for working on this. From my perspective, there is no need for a hacky solution.'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-11-20 16:48:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2018-11-21 17:24:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-11-21 19:12:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2018-12-13 02:23:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 4264, 'date': '2019-01-24 14:35:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

is there any way to go forward here?'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2019-06-13 19:25:16.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

No progress over the past 5 months -- abandoning. Feel free to reopen it to continue working on this!'}]

commit_message:
add collectd-openstack-plugins.yaml and tag release

- The collectd-openstack-plugins repo has not made
  releases for several cycles as the primary consumers
  of this repo deployed it directly form git branches.

- This change adds tags for all outstanding release for
  the collectd-openstack-plugins repo.

Change-Id: I47c3fdad477c159b528e79eac586e23c320b95d7

commit_message:
[neutron] Create milestone-1 releases

commit_message:
Fix mongo command for checking replication status

By default, the mongo command connection address is '127.0.0.1:27017'.
If we change mongodb_port, It cause the handle 'Checking current
replication status' always connect to '127.0.0.1:27017'. So we need
add options like '--host' and '--port'.

Change-Id: I172ef3d19ff2bea97db3a5207c1a984cd188ceba
Signed-off-by: ZijianGuo <guozijn@gmail.com>
