commit_message:
Fix double word hacking test

At present, 'pycodestyle' feeds the following string into the 'tokenizer'
library:

    ["'This is the the best comment'"]

(note the added quotes because this isn't valid Python otherwise)

On previous versions of Python, this tokenizer would parse the string like so:

  (3, "'This is the the best comment'", (1, 0), (1, 30), "'This is the the best comment'")
  (0, '', (2, 0), (2, 0), '')

where (3 = 'STRING', 0 = 'ENDMARKER')

However, with the fix [1] backported to recent versions of Python, this now
resolves to:

  (3, "'This is the the best comment'", (1, 0), (1, 30), "'This is the the best comment'")
  (4, '', (1, 30), (1, 31), '')
  (0, '', (2, 0), (2, 0), '')

where (3 = 'STRING', 4 = 'NEWLINE', 0 = 'ENDMARKER')

Typically, 'pycodestyle' will run physical line checks on each line as it
parses the token:

  https://github.com/PyCQA/pycodestyle/blob/2.5.0/pycodestyle.py#L2036

For the former case above, the line doesn't include a newline which
means we never parse a 'NEWLINE' token with a logical line (the fifth
element of the token tuple) corresponding to our full line. This means
we don't here but that wasn't an issue previously since there's a
fallthrough case that handled tokens remaining at the end of the parse:

  https://github.com/PyCQA/pycodestyle/blob/2.5.0/pycodestyle.py#L2114-L2116

Unfortunately, because we now have an additional newline character to
parse, one that's on a separate line to our test string no less, we run
logical checks on it:

  https://github.com/PyCQA/pycodestyle/blob/2.5.0/pycodestyle.py#L2105-L2107

This is an issue since the logical check wipes stored tokens meaning
we've nothing to check when we get to the fallthrough case:

  https://github.com/PyCQA/pycodestyle/blob/2.5.0/pycodestyle.py#L2012

This fixes changes things so that a newline is included (and also adds
quotes so it's valid Python, but that's mostly unrelated). This means we
end up with the following instead:

  ["'This is the the best comment'\n"]

On both Python without the bugfix and with it, this parses as:

  (3, "'This is the the best comment'", (1, 0), (1, 30), "'This is the the best comment'\n")
  (4, '\n', (1, 30), (1, 31), "'This is the the best comment'\n")
  (0, '', (2, 0), (2, 0), '')

where (3 = 'STRING', 4 = 'NEWLINE', 0 = 'ENDMARKER')

Which triggers things in 'pycodestyle' correctly.

  https://github.com/PyCQA/pycodestyle/blob/2.5.0/pycodestyle.py#L2044-L2046

This isn't _really_ a fix since there's clearly still a bug in either
'pycodestyle' or Python (I think the latter, since it's adding a newline
to a file that explicitly doesn't have one), but the chances of us
hitting this bug in practice are rather low - you'd need to make a
mistake on the very last line of a file without a newline at the end
which is something Vim, for example, won't even let you do without
setting special flags - and therefore it can be reasonably ignored.

[1] https://bugs.python.org/issue33899

Change-Id: Ia597594e0469c0e83d7ad22b0678390aaebaffe7
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: #1804062

commit_message:
Install iputils package in neutron containers

This package provides e.g. arping tool which is used by Neutron
services.
On e.g. RHEL7 it was probably installed as some dependency to other
package but on RHEL8 it's missing which cause some errors e.g.
in neutron_l3_agent container.

Change-Id: I9c087164f32cb8a69d2155bc68b6f62233ad58c6
Related-Bug: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1713321
(cherry picked from commit 68b998f27efb252a73b0ee4e496d4a3ce32206e2)

[{'created': '2019-06-12 10:50:01.000000000', 'message': 'Fix log owner on computes during overcloud deploy runs

[1] switched to run nova-manage discovery as non root user. In case of
updates there can be already a nove-manage log owned by root from previous
runs. This change make sure we change the owner of nova-manage log to
nova:nova on overcloud deploy runs on the computes

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/652039/13/deployment/nova/nova-compute-container-puppet.yaml

Closes-Bug: #1832482

Change-Id: Ie6d3f5262f7eb20ef92b07f2f359d88cb77b8752
(cherry picked from commit ccabc8f8e68c12321b98e4ada12c005d61b724a1)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix log owner on computes during overcloud deploy runs

[1] switched to run nova-manage discovery as non root user. In case of
updates there can be already a nove-manage log owned by root from previous
runs. This change make sure we change the owner of nova-manage log to
nova:nova on overcloud deploy runs on the computes

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/652039/13/deployment/nova/nova-compute-container-puppet.yaml

Closes-Bug: #1832482

Change-Id: Ie6d3f5262f7eb20ef92b07f2f359d88cb77b8752
(cherry picked from commit ccabc8f8e68c12321b98e4ada12c005d61b724a1)

commit_message:
Force ansible serial to 1 for the Controller

By introducing update_serial variable we parallelize update
execution on non-pacemaker enabled nodes. Custom role data users
need to update their role files. By default we do serial 1 making
sure nothing changes for users who didn't update their role data.

Resolves: rhbz#1652057
Closes-Bug: #1831617

Change-Id: I4ee0110a6c2b9466d81e37e5df27f5f81a6eceb5
(cherry picked from commit a59a188a6b6ef7275d318d95b17d3a692065e16a)

commit_message:
Collect tripleo clouds.yaml files

Currently Tripleo Deployment creates clouds.yaml for undercloud
and standalone at ~/.config/openstack or /etc/openstack folder,

These files needs to be collected to verify the deployment or
tempest tests runned.

Change-Id: I36e412e956178655913ee1bf5a92346ba863ad33
Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add new api to list template versions supported

Will print also the status which can be CURRENT, SUPPORTED
or DEPRECATED

At the moment we support all templates, we might deprecate the
old ones in the future

commit_message:
Fix bare variable usage in ansible

We have some bare variable usages in the deployments.yaml that is
causing a deprecation warning during the deployment. Let's include a
|bool to address these warnings.

Change-Id: I85dfc93eb8afaec3d3157083bcf9605c34a540eb
Closes-Bug: #1832402

commit_message:
Spec to pre-filter disabled computes with placement

This blueprint proposes to make nova report a trait to placement when a
compute service is disabled and a request filter in the scheduler which
will use that trait to filter out allocation candidates with that
forbidden trait.

Spec for blueprint pre-filter-disabled-computes

Change-Id: Ia8252028c04b93bbcc783a30baf7d282269dcbc5

commit_message:
Mark Veritas Access Driver Unsupported

The Veritas Access Driver 3rd Party CI hasn't
reported in 80 days.  This does not meet the requirements
for Cinder's 3rd Party CI requirements.

As a result the driver is being marked unsupported in the
Train release and should be removed in the 'U' release if
the problems are not resolved.

Change-Id: I3897a7da8d306cca20603f983f845ee89b05f398

Per default 'osapi_compute' and 'metadata' is set for the enabled_apis
in nova api. As metadata eventlet is depracated and we have a dedicated

Change-Id: Id62de6915307940101cb32eefd727dd80c9cdfdf
Closes-Bug: #1832537

commit_message:
Only enable osapi_compute in nova_api

Per default 'osapi_compute' and 'metadata' is set for the enabled_apis
in nova api. As metadata eventlet is depracated and we have a dedicated
nova_metadata service we need to disable metadata and only enable
osapi_compute.

Change-Id: Id62de6915307940101cb32eefd727dd80c9cdfdf
Closes-Bug: #1832537

Before neutron-server transitions a port to ACTIVE, it'll wait
until the metadata service has been provisioned on that hypervisor.
If the port doesn't belong to any IPv4 subnet with DHCP enabled,
there's no need to wait for it.

Change-Id: Iba3969e43c76ca07fe840b84d8f81f34bc7e5cd6

commit_message:
Don't wait for metadata service unnecessarily

Before neutron-server transitions a port to ACTIVE, it'll wait
until the metadata service has been provisioned on that hypervisor.
If the port doesn't belong to any IPv4 subnet with DHCP enabled,
there's no need to wait for it.

Change-Id: Iba3969e43c76ca07fe840b84d8f81f34bc7e5cd6
Closes-Bug: #1828585
Signed-off-by: Daniel Alvarez <dalvarez@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 1888f19d24b17697d3a7cd5c5a0ea550af3ddb66)

commit_message:
Use os-cloud instead of OS env vars for functional tests

In order to support switching auth contexts, such as for registered_limits
which take a system scoped token, switch the functional tests to using
the --os-cloud command line parameter. However, honor the OS_CLOUD env var
as a way that someone can select a different cloud, including 'envvars',
to use.

Use devstack-system-admin cloud for limit tests

Keystone requires these to have system scope now.

Change-Id: Ia81eebd3e00ae986cf3ba7e3d98f3e8a1647b622

Remove _create_incomplete_consumers_for_provider and
_create_incomplete_consumer from placement.objects.allocation as

commit_message:
Remove incomplete consumer inline migrations

Remove _create_incomplete_consumers_for_provider and
_create_incomplete_consumer from placement.objects.allocation as
we now have a blocker migration which means there should no longer
be any incomplete consumers.

Tests are updated, with one test that was testing both the online and
inline migrations modified to simply confirm the online migration.

Change-Id: I5a29685d1e22c66e4d09f04198c011e71340a5d0

commit_message:
Add a blocker migration for missing consumer records

There are several TODO throughout the code about ensuring
consumer records calls that can be removed once there is
blocker migration that will fail if there are missing
consumer records.

This patch adds that blocker migration. Subsequent patches
will remove the redundant code.

Change-Id: I6029c5095ed1e6ff7c46d480454db1382073bd57

[{'created': '2019-06-07 15:02:32.000000000', 'message': 'Fix lBaaS sg rules corresponding to the NP rules are being deleted

The LBaaS security group rules created to enforce the Network Policy
applied on the backend pods are being deleted, because are considered
to be default lbaas rule, when they are not.
This commit fixes the issue by adding a new factor to define whether
a lbaas rule is default or not. It checks if the description of the
rule contains a part of the description added to the rules created
when parsing the network policy sg rules, if it has than it should
not be deleted.

Change-Id: Iebbbd75990fe626cede00440121a9d2c2f3efaa0
Closes-Bug: 1832010
'}]
commit_message:
Fix lBaaS sg rules corresponding to the NP rules are being deleted

The LBaaS security group rules created to enforce the Network Policy
applied on the backend pods are being deleted, because are considered
to be default lbaas rule, when they are not.
This commit fixes the issue by adding a new factor to define whether
a lbaas rule is default or not. It checks if the description of the
rule contains a part of the description added to the rules created
when parsing the network policy sg rules, if it has than it should
not be deleted.

Change-Id: Iebbbd75990fe626cede00440121a9d2c2f3efaa0
Closes-Bug: 1832010

commit_message:
Fix Pod creation do not triggers affected SVC SG update

The LBaaS SG is not updated when a pod that is referenced by a
service has a network policy that restrict/accept traffic from
pods in different namespaces. For example: pod-A on namespace-A is
created and according to a network policy should affects the traffic
to pod-B on namespace-B, and consequently to the service that has
pod B as a backend pod.

Closes-Bug: 1830598
(cherry picked from commit 8f035cd1c1ad023b8192f8c25fb7750b2d7265b3)

Change-Id: Idb3365e70e66dd8544f5b97aece312bc18c57ee5

commit_message:
Software RAID: Protect RAID metadata upon cleaning

During automatic cleaning, the generic hardware manager erases the
data and the metadata on all block devices. If this is done on RAID
members, the RAID device is destroyed. This patch proposes to exclude
RAID members from (meta)data cleaning.

Change-Id: I9ec7674925d981062c311cf34eadfe4cb891f077
Story: #2004581
Task: #33640

commit_message:
remove release notes job

Since the master branch of neutron-lbaas has been removed (retired),
the release notes job will not longer work as it runs release notes
build from master branch which does not exist any more for lbaas.

The infra/release team need to discuss how to address this issue, but
for now this patch proposes to just remove the release notes job. We
can add it back if/when a conclusion is reached on how to address it.

Change-Id: Ib9b1ee5af2a7a9d2b9838a4bbd8e9b8670749886

Slight preference for consistency and having only openstack/ releases handled by the openstack release team and the openstack/releases repository. Happy to be overruled though :)'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-05-24 11:00:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Do we want to remove those now? I had considered the question of whether releases would now be done via the release team separate from this.'}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2019-05-24 18:09:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

I asked the other StoryBoard maintainers for details on this, and apparently there was some discussion at the PTG about wanting to start doing more releases.

Due to the lack of need for release coordination with the rest of OpenStack however, and the fact that releases can generally be performed easily enough by just pushing a signed tag to Gerrit, I'm happy to help make opendev/python-storyboardclient (and I guess opendev/yaml2ical as well?) releases on request or assist with getting the necessary Gerrit ACLs in place to allow other developers on those projects do the same."}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2019-05-28 02:09:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

> I asked the other StoryBoard maintainers for details on this, and
 > apparently there was some discussion at the PTG about wanting to
 > start doing more releases.
 > 
 > Due to the lack of need for release coordination with the rest of
 > OpenStack however, and the fact that releases can generally be
 > performed easily enough by just pushing a signed tag to Gerrit, I'm
 > happy to help make opendev/python-storyboardclient (and I guess
 > opendev/yaml2ical as well?) releases on request or assist with
 > getting the necessary Gerrit ACLs in place to allow other
 > developers on those projects do the same.

Okay with that in mind I think we can drop those deliverables from this repo and followup with the *storyboard/yaml2ical releases on email/IRC."}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-05-28 14:53:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2019-05-29 00:31:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2019-05-31 11:08:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2019-06-13 09:49:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

Update sphinx version in requirement.txt

commit_message:
Add nova-status Ansible role

This patch adds a new role which performs a pre-upgrade check on the
nova-api service.

Change-Id: I0dae1b4dc3c945c66e03aa7b361b329f9a25cc99
Implements: blueprint validation-framework
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>

messages: [{'account_id': 30288, 'date': '2019-06-05 15:49:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2019-06-10 13:44:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2019-06-13 07:39:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-06-05 15:49:34.000000000', 'message': "Support deleting all routes in update_router

There was previously no way to remove all routes from a router with the
update_router function because it only processed the routes if the
statement 'if routes' evaluated to True, which an empty list did not.

Modified the unit test for cloud/test_router so that it initialises the
test router with routes, and confirms that they are removed.

Change-Id: I9f31ad33eb500f59eb7634ea9e7e6502362a375b
Story: 2005089
Task: 29685
"}]
commit_message:
Support deleting all routes in update_router

There was previously no way to remove all routes from a router with the
update_router function because it only processed the routes if the
statement 'if routes' evaluated to True, which an empty list did not.

Modified the unit test for cloud/test_router so that it initialises the
test router with routes, and confirms that they are removed.

Change-Id: I9f31ad33eb500f59eb7634ea9e7e6502362a375b
Story: 2005089
Task: 29685

commit_message:
Cap paramiko to releases below 2.5.0

This new version makes the kayobe-tox-molecule job fail with:

    ImportError: cannot import name py31compat

commit_message:
Dropping the py35 testing

All the integration testing has been moved to
Bionic now[1] and py3.5 is not tested runtime for
Train or stable/stein[2].

As per below ML thread, we are good to drop the py35
testing now:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-April/005097.html

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-April/004647.html
[2]
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/stein.html
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/train.html

Change-Id: I41c1f2b620a06298a0976d3f52faf65d74d78cae

commit_message:
Include OData-Version header in Redfish requests

It is recommeded by the Redfish spec to send the OData-Version header
in requests. This improves interoperability.

The logic to add the OData-Version header is in the _op() method of
the Connector class so that it only needs to be done in one place.

Change-Id: Ia74dadf8f383566e00f2ed092f610a8070730aa2
Story: 2003514
Task: 33600

[{'created': '2019-06-10 14:19:02.000000000', 'message': "Fix python3 compatibility of rbd get_fsid

In python3 librados's get_fsid() function is represented as binary.
Because of this, conditional where fsid is compared with fsid parsed
from glance's direct url is not true, then cinder-glance
acceleration is not working. This patch is fixing this.
More informations are in closing bug.

Closes-Bug: #1816468

Change-Id: I69d0685ec845355329f771f27f8894d9e988ae35
(cherry picked from commit ed84f34562da21a53b6d45611a5bcf9e3edd1e84)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix python3 compatibility of rbd get_fsid

In python3 librados's get_fsid() function is represented as binary.
Because of this, conditional where fsid is compared with fsid parsed
from glance's direct url is not true, then cinder-glance
acceleration is not working. This patch is fixing this.
More informations are in closing bug.

Closes-Bug: #1816468

Change-Id: I69d0685ec845355329f771f27f8894d9e988ae35
(cherry picked from commit ed84f34562da21a53b6d45611a5bcf9e3edd1e84)

commit_message:
Fix log owner on computes during overcloud deploy runs

[1] switched to run nova-manage discovery as non root user. In case of
updates there can be already a nove-manage log owned by root from previous
runs. This change make sure we change the owner of nova-manage log to
nova:nova on overcloud deploy runs on the computes

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/652039/13/deployment/nova/nova-compute-container-puppet.yaml

Closes-Bug: #1832482

Change-Id: Ie6d3f5262f7eb20ef92b07f2f359d88cb77b8752

adjustments.

[{'account_id': 30361, 'date': '2019-05-02 12:24:04.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2019-05-02 12:24:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
Workflow: https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html

messages:
[{'account_id': 26575, 'date': '2019-05-31 06:50:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 26575, 'date': '2019-05-31 07:30:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 26575, 'date': '2019-05-31 09:04:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I saw this error in Zuul Log:

WARNING: possible mismatch found for package "sphinx"
   Attribute "markers" does not match
   "" does not match "python_version=='2.7'"
   Requirement(package='sphinx', location='', specifiers='!=1.6.6,!=1.6.7,>=1.6.5', markers='', comment='# BSD', extras=frozenset())
   Requirement(package='sphinx', location='', specifiers='!=1.6.6,!=1.6.7,<2.0.0', markers="python_version=='2.7'", comment='# BSD', extras=frozenset())
WARNING: possible mismatch found for package "sphinx"
   Attribute "markers" does not match
   "" does not match "python_version>='3.4'"
   Requirement(package='sphinx', location='', specifiers='!=1.6.6,!=1.6.7,>=1.6.5', markers='', comment='# BSD', extras=frozenset())
   Requirement(package='sphinx', location='', specifiers='!=1.6.6,!=1.6.7', markers="python_version>='3.4'", comment='# BSD', extras=frozenset())
ERROR: Could not find a global requirements entry to match package sphinx. If the package is already included in the global list, the name or platform markers there may not match the local settings.

And in tox log, I am seeing this:

2019-05-31 07:36:34.258667 | ubuntu-bionic | ERROR: Double requirement given: hacking<1.2.0,>=1.1.0 (from -r https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/nova/plain/test-requirements.txt (line 5)) (already in hacking!=0.13.0,<0.14,>=0.12.0 (from -r /home/zuul/src/opendev.org/openstack/nova-powervm/test-requirements.txt (line 4)), name='hacking')
2019-05-31 07:36:34.258692 | ubuntu-bionic |
2019-05-31 07:36:34.258778 | ubuntu-bionic | =================================== log end ====================================
2019-05-31 07:36:34.259482 | ubuntu-bionic | ERROR: could not install deps [-c/home/zuul/src/opendev.org/openstack/requirements/upper-constraints.txt, -r/home/zuul/src/opendev.org/openstack/nova-powervm/requirements.txt, -r/home/zuul/src/opendev.org/openstack/nova-powervm/test-requirements.txt, -egit+https://git.openstack.org/openstack/nova#egg=nova, -rhttps://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/nova/plain/test-requirements.txt]; v = InvocationError(u"/home/zuul/src/opendev.org/openstack/nova-powervm/.tox/pep8/bin/pip install -c/home/zuul/src/opendev.org/openstack/requirements/upper-constraints.txt -r/home/zuul/src/opendev.org/openstack/nova-powervm/requirements.txt -r/home/zuul/src/opendev.org/openstack/nova-powervm/test-requirements.txt '-egit+https://git.openstack.org/openstack/nova#egg=nova' -rhttps://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/nova/plain/test-requirements.txt", 1)
2019-05-31 07:36:34.259571 | ubuntu-bionic | ___________________________________ summary ____________________________________
2019-05-31 07:36:34.260279 | ubuntu-bionic | ERROR:   pep8: could not install deps [-c/home/zuul/src/opendev.org/openstack/requirements/upper-constraints.txt, -r/home/zuul/src/opendev.org/openstack/nova-powervm/requirements.txt, -r/home/zuul/src/opendev.org/openstack/nova-powervm/test-requirements.txt, -egit+https://git.openstack.org/openstack/nova#egg=nova, -rhttps://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/nova/plain/test-requirements.txt]; v = InvocationError(u"/home/zuul/src/opendev.org/openstack/nova-powervm/.tox/pep8/bin/pip install -c/home/zuul/src/opendev.org/openstack/requirements/upper-constraints.txt -r/home/zuul/src/opendev.org/openstack/nova-powervm/requirements.txt -r/home/zuul/src/opendev.org/openstack/nova-powervm/test-requirements.txt '-egit+https://git.openstack.org/openstack/nova#egg=nova' -rhttps://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/nova/plain/test-requirements.txt", 1)'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-05-31 13:36:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

Yup, looks like it's been a while since you synced with global & nova requirements.

For sphinx, you need to cap under 2.0.0 for python2.7 - just copy from global requirements [1].

For hacking, you could copy nova's requirement [2]. Or you could just remove your entry from test-requirements.txt - then your -r line will always just be dynamically pulling in exactly what nova has. Either way, it's possible that pep8 will fail due to new hacking rules, so you'll have to fix any failures there.

You may want to consider doing the requirements syncs in a separate change underneath this one. Basically an isolated patch to get zuul passing before you start fixing nova-powervm itself.

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/requirements/src/branch/master/global-requirements.txt#L459-L460
[2] https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/src/branch/master/test-requirements.txt#L5"}, {'account_id': 30044, 'date': '2019-06-04 07:47:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Update nova-powervm requirements.
https://review.opendev.org/#/c/662959/'}, {'account_id': 13637, 'date': '2019-06-13 07:55:29.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Already covered as part of https://review.opendev.org/#/c/663868/'}]

commit_message:
Changing import in driver class for nova_powervm

This change set is to correct the import statement in driver
class - os_resource_classes now provides cpu, ram and disk
keys instead of rc_fields class.

Change-Id: I1e2993aafb64920729fc87081bdd9337a81b1b6f
Closes-Bug: #1831034

Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
Workflow: https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 30044, 'date': '2019-06-04 08:54:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-06-04 09:49:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Note that you can test locally by running 

 tox

In this case, since you're changing requirements, you should rebuild the venv each time 

 tox -r

To limit your test to a specific environment, use -e <env>, like 

 tox -r -e py27"}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-06-04 09:50:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

By the way, in this case the problem appears to be (at least) that you need to sync up test-requirements.txt as well.'}, {'account_id': 13637, 'date': '2019-06-13 07:54:57.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Already covered as part of https://review.opendev.org/#/c/663868/'}]

commit_message:
Switch to new engine facade for Subnet object

Enable the new Engine Facade for Subnet objects.

Partially-Implements blueprint: enginefacade-switch

Change-Id: I7b6f9fa7c3d1138022040f7555266cecce74b9c8

[{'account_id': 24162, 'date': '2019-04-16 10:40:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 24162, 'date': '2019-04-16 10:54:26.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 24162, 'date': '2019-04-16 11:18:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 8175, 'date': '2019-04-16 13:07:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

(6 comments)

my main concern is splitting what is bootstrap and what is the test itself. Perhaps making the molecule base patch and then adding the test in a separate change?? A README would help clarifying this, showing the dir structure and the bootstrap vs test files.'}, {'account_id': 24162, 'date': '2019-04-16 16:58:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(5 comments)'}, {'account_id': 24162, 'date': '2019-04-17 12:04:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 8449, 'date': '2019-04-23 06:26:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1

(1 comment)

needs rebase but otherwise lets merge this asap so folks can see/try it

i have a question but not sure if it will come out right in gerrit :) maybe better on the phone later today

but

what does molecule give us? I mean, i see you have a playbook there https://review.opendev.org/#/c/652971/4/molecule/install-deps/playbook.yml which does the test. I mean copy install-deps.sh to some target and run it. So, molecule provides a way to express& install all the requirements needed to run that test, and then an easy way to invoke it and get nice formatted results?'}, {'account_id': 8367, 'date': '2019-04-23 08:38:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 24162, 'date': '2019-04-25 09:10:21.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 9592, 'date': '2019-04-25 20:12:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 9592, 'date': '2019-04-25 20:18:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: -Code-Review

would like to +2 get this merged but it should only trigger on changes to install-deps.sh and some config right?'}, {'account_id': 24162, 'date': '2019-04-27 06:39:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 24162, 'date': '2019-04-27 06:47:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

Wes, regarding conditional triggering of molecule tests, I am mostly against it, at least until their duration will become an issue.

Reasons for that: they can break from external causes (pip, distro, images,) and also from hard to identify internal dependencies like inclusion of another role, changes in zuul job definitions (even on base repositories).

As the same job will test multiple roles I would argue not to put conditions inside zuul job definition.

I do have plans to make better decisions on when to run or skip but this is for the future, when we will have many tests and total duration would be more problematic.

(me trying to avoid premature optimization)'}, {'account_id': 9592, 'date': '2019-04-27 19:45:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

trigger on all changes to the repo? is that the intent?'}, {'account_id': 8367, 'date': '2019-04-30 09:00:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 8175, 'date': '2019-05-02 19:06:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 10022, 'date': '2019-05-23 14:09:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review-1

(4 comments)'}, {'account_id': 24162, 'date': '2019-05-23 14:24:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Published edit on patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 24162, 'date': '2019-05-23 14:24:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Patch Set 7 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 24162, 'date': '2019-05-23 14:24:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

(3 comments)'}, {'account_id': 24162, 'date': '2019-06-04 10:28:07.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 24162, 'date': '2019-06-04 15:53:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 10022, 'date': '2019-06-05 10:34:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9: Code-Review+2

of calling molecule directly if they want: `molecule test --all`.

commit_message:
Test install-deps.sh script using pytest/molecule

Adds one molecule scenario that deploys install-deps.sh on targeted
platforms and runs it there.

Job uses pytest for orchestration but developers have the freedom
of calling molecule directly if they want: `molecule test --all`.

Change-Id: I465891dd600ca0353a4124f46adc13259a527aa0
Task: https://tree.taiga.io/project/tripleo-ci-board/task/1021
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/663599/

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-06-07 20:48:15.000000000', 'message': "Add SchedulerReportClient.get_provider_by_name

This adds a public get_provider_by_name to expose access to
_get_provider_by_name for callers outside of SchedulerReportClient.
It acts as a simple passthrough and is used to handle the
@safe_connect decorator on the _get_provider_by_name method
returning None so the public method will raise
PlacementAPIConnectFailure.

The two existing calls for adding/removing providers to/from
aggregates are updated to use the public method so they don't
need to individually do the safe_connect handling. As a result,
existing tests should be sufficient for this simple refactor.

Change-Id: I504c374d3863a2a956d5c0156a43be2d2a2bc712
"}, {'created': '2019-06-10 14:36:16.000000000', 'message': "Make get_provider_by_name public and remove safe_connect

This makes _get_provider_by_name public to expose access for
callers outside of SchedulerReportClient. The @safe_connect
decorator is removed and the get() is wrapped in a try/except
to handle KSA ClientException errors and raise
PlacementAPIConnectFailure.

The two existing calls for adding/removing providers to/from
aggregates are updated to use the public method so they don't
need to individually do the safe_connect handling.

Change-Id: I504c374d3863a2a956d5c0156a43be2d2a2bc712
"}, {'created': '2019-06-11 23:33:21.000000000', 'message': "Make get_provider_by_name public and remove safe_connect

callers outside of SchedulerReportClient. The @safe_connect

to handle KSA ClientException errors and raise
PlacementAPIConnectFailure.

The two existing calls for adding/removing providers to/from

need to individually do the safe_connect handling.

Change-Id: I504c374d3863a2a956d5c0156a43be2d2a2bc712
"}]
commit_message:
Make get_provider_by_name public and remove safe_connect

This makes _get_provider_by_name public to expose access for
callers outside of SchedulerReportClient. The @safe_connect
decorator is removed and the get() is wrapped in a try/except
to handle KSA ClientException errors and raise
PlacementAPIConnectFailure.

The two existing calls for adding/removing providers to/from
aggregates are updated to use the public method so they don't
need to individually do the safe_connect handling.

Change-Id: I504c374d3863a2a956d5c0156a43be2d2a2bc712

commit_message:
Bump up minimum cryptography version

...not because we strictly *need* newer cryptography, but rather because
distro packages have moved forward to the point where the 1.x series
won't compile from source and PyPI doesn't have wheels for them.

See changes like:

- https://github.com/pyca/cryptography/commit/6e7ea2e
- https://github.com/pyca/cryptography/commit/f88aea5

Change-Id: I1ff5b61873cf382c7a89873ed4ba6153f299262a

zuul jobs seem to be failing due to the version of pycodestyle. It expects the version to be 2.0.0 but instead gets 2.5.0 and complains about it.

commit_message:
masakari: Drop hacking tests

We don't want to depend on pep8/hacking and it's useless to run these
tests again during package build.

Change-Id: I3d70d1553c9b98a52c2978553005cb4bee45bba0
(cherry picked from commit 35d0fac26e2df83ae50667f9a1f01c4ca840e412)

commit_message:
Retire independent ansible role

All of the tripleo ansible roles have been retired. The transformation squad
is pivoting away from independent roles at this time and will be focusing on
the tripleo-ansible repository. For more information on the tripleo-ansible
efforts and the direction of the transformation squad please review the
following mailing list thread [0].

[0] - http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-June/006836.html

Change-Id: Ia22150be91e7f45f59be4bab381727faa3d637df
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add a Theory of Auto-Scaling document

As discussed at the Denver PTG, create a document to describe some
concepts for a user to understand when using auto-scaling.

Original draft at
https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Auto-scaling_SIG/Theory_of_Auto-Scaling

Change-Id: Id3fb78adca4ca0032de4ca15b7c9c821bdfe756f

commit_message:
Add auto-scaling with lifecycle hook use case

Add use case for auto-scaling compute resources that are running
workloads which require draining using lifecycle hooks before resources
are scaled in.

Change-Id: I0bc662b9ea8d4c6b3efbc0488eb2c8e17167090f
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/662094/
Story: 2005751
Task: 33433

commit_message:
Capture initial set of Use Cases

Pulling from the etherpad at the Denver 2019 PTG and inserting in
to the template format.  Much more detail can be fleshed out, but
this gives a framework to start.

Change-Id: If15093cb80f1230f3a626253676c88d162cbb2b2
Story: 2005751
Task: 33433

commit_message:
Add a generic coordination lock mechanism

For various synchronized scenarios, this decorator
allows flexible lock name with parameters and names
of underlying functions.
For instance:
    @synchronized('{f_name}-{resource.id}-{snap[name]}')
    def foo(self, resource, snap):

Change-Id: I4bf75be2902cd598a5a5a2c5887d4b4262f3e042
Related-Bug: #1824911

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
Workflow: https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 9592, 'date': '2019-06-12 21:20:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-06-12 17:40:34.000000000', 'message': "WIP: ComputeVirtAPI.allocations_for_instance

Adds a ComputeVirtAPI method allocations_for_instance to query Placement
and return the allocations dict for an Instance.

Currently does not use caching. We suspect there by tygers; and it
should be a rare call; and it's quick; and it's likely to be part of a
not-super-quick operation anyway (like attach volume).

Change-Id: I73005b48b526fc5a1061fc09d8f57d8c925e23b1
"}]
commit_message:
WIP: ComputeVirtAPI.allocations_for_instance

Adds a ComputeVirtAPI method allocations_for_instance to query Placement
and return the allocations dict for an Instance.

Currently does not use caching. We suspect there by tygers; and it
should be a rare call; and it's quick; and it's likely to be part of a
not-super-quick operation anyway (like attach volume).

Change-Id: I73005b48b526fc5a1061fc09d8f57d8c925e23b1

commit_message:
Fixes multiple chassis delete

Now ironic can delete multiple chassis and if any one of the chassis
contains node then it will not delete that chassis and delete's other
chassis.

Closes-Bug: #1644591
Change-Id: I7e55aa8f7a416d7ad59b8ecb50f370e5e74d51cd

commit_message:
lvm2 is required for cinder

explicitly require lvm2 to be sure the
lvm commands are available to cinder.

Related-Bug: #1824210
Change-Id: I00c67ae30dca7fa16d7b3fe23fcf2256c0c1d194

commit_message:
Configure server_certs_key_passphrase for Octavia

A recent change[1] to Octavia added a parameter named
server_certs_key_passphrase, which means that TripleO should
generate a password for it to avoid using the default value.

This patch adds OctaviaServerCertsKeyPassphrase to the list
of parameters TripleO configures in Octavia.

Closes-Bug: #1821756
Related-Bug: #1821751

[1] I06d329ca53bc36bd27f7870ae7c7ca0cf18575b2
Depends-On: I9699961faf8b3430e4372e4ff3ae2bf7e7ceea18
Depends-On: Id6c0d156715147c6559dc39098a6eaabf77ac426
Depends-On: I5e60e8fbb7af381b59c6d7b02d5ba8eb47e91720
Change-Id: Icadd090f027af6f958c25af6bfb09195a4019aa8
(cherry picked from commit 4559d3b74f6827e6509f04b158cfbeba26041e22)

commit_message:
Adjust filter_type to query when does not have the list_users permission

Create a new project and switch to it. On the user page,
filtering by username and user ID has no effect.
This patch is adjust filter_type to query when the user
does not have the list_users permission

Change-Id: I1ab3ce4bffbc2902246cf4828e9073d65674c183

commit_message:
Revert "Revert "opendev.org mirrors: switch out DFW, switch in IAD""

This reverts commit d8b7f2da286f88a4bb687897f6f514384871aa6e.

The IAD server is now running 5.1.9 stable kernel, so we can try again
for a little and see what we get.  We also have some debugging plans
(capturing /proc/<pid>/stack for apache) if it doesn't quite work.

Change-Id: I250596015d9d0fa4f37112c05c48a70957968ac1

commit_message:
Blacklist bandit 1.6.0 and cap Sphinx on Python2

There's a regression[0] in bandit 1.6.0 which causes bandit to stop
respecting excluded directories, and our tests throw a bunch of
violations. Blacklist this version, but allow newer versions as there is
already a pull request[1] to fix it, and I expect it will be included in
the next release.

Also fix the requirements job which was broken by
https://review.opendev.org/657890 adding a cap on Sphinx on Python 2.

[0] https://github.com/PyCQA/bandit/issues/488
[1] https://github.com/PyCQA/bandit/pull/489

Co-Authored-By: Jake Yip <jake.yip@unimelb.edu.au>

Task: 33401
Story: 2005740

Change-Id: I34dc36c5236debc42424073af2c2d2104e18179a
(cherry picked from commit 913636b6b1fdcdbcfed951ad1ca68a5f84f7b8e0)
(cherry picked from commit eec7184fbc2de00d30752f16160c9553bdd2df7d)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-06-11 13:18:35.000000000', 'message': 'Revert "Pass network's dns_domain to dnsmasq conf"

The dns_domain attribute of a network is intended for use
by neutron when creating DNS records in an external DNS
system such as Designate.

By using the networks dns_domain, the configured search
path on booted instances mismatches with the generated
dns assignments for instance ports in the hosts file
for dnsmasq which creates a mismatched forward/reverse
lookup behaviour.

This reverts commit 7fdd6adc7acf99e74fbe1c12606f8c867ae134ae.
and commit 137a6d61053fb1cfb9a0a583b5a5c0f6253c75e6.

Closes-Bug: 1826419
Depends-On: I145144c042b100f7e12a02a8ac7e0fbbe41e984d
Change-Id: I5ff03b5ad8af432a9f7919ef953d7d8c434b93bd
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Pass network's dns_domain to dnsmasq conf"

The dns_domain attribute of a network is intended for use
by neutron when creating DNS records in an external DNS
system such as Designate.

By using the networks dns_domain, the configured search
path on booted instances mismatches with the generated
dns assignments for instance ports in the hosts file
for dnsmasq which creates a mismatched forward/reverse
lookup behaviour.

This reverts commit 7fdd6adc7acf99e74fbe1c12606f8c867ae134ae.
and commit 137a6d61053fb1cfb9a0a583b5a5c0f6253c75e6.

Closes-Bug: 1826419
Depends-On: I145144c042b100f7e12a02a8ac7e0fbbe41e984d
Change-Id: I5ff03b5ad8af432a9f7919ef953d7d8c434b93bd

a refresh of the info because we can't be sure that the cache is
up-to-date.

commit_message:
Refresh instance network info on deletion

When deleting an instance, if the network info is empty, we should
refresh the info because we can't be sure the copy of the cache we
have when we fetched the instance to delete is up-to-date, i.e. if
we're racing to delete the server while it's building and the
network info cache was updated in the database after we started the
delete operation and got the instance from the DB, then we could
fail to unplug VIFs.

Closes-Bug: #1830081

Change-Id: I99601773406c61f93002e2f7cbb248cf73cef0ab
Signed-off-by: Arnaud Morin <arnaud.morin@corp.ovh.com>

commit_message:
Fix live-migration when glance image deleted

When block live-migration is run on instance with
a deleted glance image, image.cache() is called
without specyfing instance disk size parameter,
preventing the resize of disk on the target host.

Change-Id: Id0f05bb1275cc816d98b662820e02eae25dc57a3
Closes-Bug: #1829000
(cherry picked from commit c1782bacd8461bdd8c833792864e61228fa451f1)
(cherry picked from commit b45f47c7577f7b9694ba0a6060312f1a0ec06abd)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-06-12 09:02:50.000000000', 'message': 'Fix RedisVirtualIP when overrdiing InternalApi name_lower

When overriding RedisVirtualIP name_lower and using the
service_net_map_replace the overridden name_lower is was
not used in VipSubnetMapDefaults.

Get name_lower from the _service_nets jinja2 variable
which holds the replaced name_lower for the network when
service_net_map_replace is used.

Closes-Bug: #1832461
Change-Id: I839474dcce749fc3a75ae0e1be16780ddb83f5b3
'}]
commit_message:
Fix RedisVirtualIP when overrdiing InternalApi name_lower

When overriding RedisVirtualIP name_lower and using the
service_net_map_replace the overridden name_lower is was
not used in VipSubnetMapDefaults.

Get name_lower from the _service_nets jinja2 variable
which holds the replaced name_lower for the network when
service_net_map_replace is used.

Closes-Bug: #1832461
Change-Id: I839474dcce749fc3a75ae0e1be16780ddb83f5b3

'}, {'created': '2019-02-15 00:15:57.000000000', 'message': 'Ceph Provisioners helm tests

In order to run this test, it is required that

This test can be executed during initial Ceph-provisioner

during activating namespace to use
ceph (i.e. ceph-openstack-config)

commit_message:
Add helm tests for Ceph Provisioners chart

- Adding helm tests for Ceph provisioner chart
- Helm test should only executed when deploying chart with
client_secrets: true.

Co-Authored-By: Chinasubbareddy Mallavarapu <cr3938@att.com>

Change-Id: I33421249246dfaf6ea4f835e76a74813dfb3b595

subject: Fix guidelines w.r.t. translation of log messages
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 2394, 'name': 'Adam Spiers', 'email': 'aspiers@suse.com', 'username': 'adam.spiers'}, {'_account_id': 2472, 'name': 'Doug Hellmann', 'email': 'dhellmann@redhat.com', 'username': 'doug-hellmann'}, {'_account_id': 2750, 'name': 'Sean Dague', 'email': 'sean@dague.net', 'username': 'sdague'}, {'_account_id': 6928, 'name': 'Ben Nemec', 'email': 'openstack@nemebean.com', 'username': 'bnemec'}, {'_account_id': 9796, 'name': 'ChangBo Guo', 'email': 'glongwave@gmail.com', 'username': 'gcb'}, {'_account_id': 11904, 'name': 'Sean McGinnis', 'email': 'sean.mcginnis@gmail.com', 'username': 'SeanM'}, {'_account_id': 14070, 'name': 'Eric Fried', 'email': 'openstack@fried.cc', 'username': 'efried'}, {'_account_id': 14482, 'name': 'Ian Y. Choi', 'email': 'ianyrchoi@gmail.com', 'username': 'ianychoi'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 2394, 'date': '2019-06-12 10:55:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-06-12 12:22:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

I'd like to see more information related to string interpolation added to this doc (using "," versus "%" for the format values), but that is really a different focus than what this is addressing.

Looks good to me, and I think we should get the i18n references updated.'}, {'account_id': 2394, 'date': '2019-06-12 12:35:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thanks.  Any suggestions regarding my comment at https://review.opendev.org/#/c/664670/1/doc/source/user/guidelines.rst@a204 ?  We don't use openstack-specs any more.  So should we look to transfer the majority of https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/openstack-specs/specs/log-guidelines.html into oslo.log docs, and then add the variable interpolation hint there?"}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-06-12 12:50:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Thanks.  Any suggestions regarding my comment at https://review.opendev.org/#/c/664670/1/doc/source/user/guidelines.rst@a204
 > ?  We don't use openstack-specs any more.  So should we look to
 > transfer the majority of https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/openstack-specs/specs/log-guidelines.html
 > into oslo.log docs, and then add the variable interpolation hint
 > there?

That would make sense to me. An old spec doesn't seem like the right place to go for this information. It really should be in the docs themselves. And then if we have docs, adding more details there would be the right thing to do."}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2019-06-12 16:17:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2019-06-12 21:22:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

Moving the log docs to oslo.log makes sense to me. Since openstack-specs is no longer a thing, putting the best practices document in oslo.log seems reasonable.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-06-12 10:55:14.000000000', 'message': 'Fix guidelines w.r.t. translation of log messages

Translation of log messages was ceased starting with Pike, but only
the oslo.i18n documentation was only partially updated (by
Ia34ad79ca9), and not this repository.

So remove misleading examples of log translation from this
documentation.

Change-Id: Ib86013ff5e7bd07ddc696da2e4c56ce9d07f0cb6
'}]
commit_message:
Fix guidelines w.r.t. translation of log messages

Translation of log messages was ceased starting with Pike, but only
the oslo.i18n documentation was only partially updated (by
Ia34ad79ca9), and not this repository.

So remove misleading examples of log translation from this
documentation.

Change-Id: Ib86013ff5e7bd07ddc696da2e4c56ce9d07f0cb6

commit_message:
Handle lazy-load of Migration.cross_cell_move

The cross_cell_move field has a default value so we can
set the default from obj_load_attr if the field is lazy-loaded.

This is a follow up for [1].

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/614012/35/nova/objects/migration.py@115

Change-Id: I63ff7cef330ff9ad6a68243a2fe8603c54221972

- cinder-smb http://cloudbase-ci.com/cinder/620671/37/smb/ : SUCCESS in 51m 56s'}, {'account_id': 9535, 'date': '2019-03-22 13:54:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 37:

@Arkady, third party CI jobs already have the storage backend specific dependencies installed on the node where Cinder is installed, so they  just need to run cinderlib functional tests on that same node.

The best way to run the tests will depend on how they are running tempest.  If they are using Zuul and they define a run playbook, then they can do it like in this patch (including "cinder/playbooks/cinderlib-run.yaml"), if they use Zuul but inheriting from the devstack tempest job, then they can do it like the ceph job (https://review.openstack.org/645182), if they are doing it some other way they may install cinderlib using the devstack plugin (https://review.openstack.org/643014) and then add the functional tests.

The plan is to add a validation and testing section on the cinderlib docs explaining how a vendor can manually validate a driver and showing different examples on how to run it at the gate.'}, {'account_id': 18883, 'date': '2019-03-22 14:29:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 37:

commit_message:
Run cinderlib functional tests on LVM-LIO job

This patch adds the openstack/cinderlib project as a required project
for cinder-tempest-dsv-lvm-lio-barbican job and then runs its functional
tests as part of the CI job.

With this we'll be able to run cross-repo dependencies with cinderlib
for the cinder-tempest-dsv-lvm-lio-barbican job.

Change-Id: I25c19cf1f7da6881807e729a326cd94d07b4c42d

The join() in get_router_for_floatingip() is joining from entity
to entity without an explicit ON clause which creates an ambiguous

commit_message:
Join on explcit relationship paths

The join() in get_router_for_floatingip() is joining from entity
to entity without an explicit ON clause which creates an ambiguous
situation.  SQLAlchemy 1.3 guards against this now, so use the
real relationship-bound path so that the ORM does not need to guess.

Copied from https://review.opendev.org/#/c/642117/

Related-bug: #1819260
Change-Id: I9461ca708f05d037fb771b89ec7a95c403c5d1f6

'}, {'created': '2019-04-12 13:40:52.000000000', 'message': '[DNM] adds tripleo-repos molecule pytests

Adds local method for testing the validity of the modified roles via
molecule on supported platforms.

This change is adding a pytest that calls molecule to validate
tripleo-repos role on supported platforms.

The test execution degrates gracefully if no working docker host is
detected. This allows developers to run pytest even if they do not
have docker installed.

The new test is configured to run only inside tox-openstack-py27 job
in order to avoid running molecule in more than one job.

On CI this change uses a local docker installation but if the developer
wants, (s)he can just define a DOCKER_HOST=ssh://user@server variable
to enable remote execution of the containers (tested).

Change-Id: I2acecc16064b3f155de3e82368c64b060304a5e2
Story: https://tree.taiga.io/project/tripleo-ci-board/us/805

commit_message:
Adds tripleo-repos molecule test job

Adds local method for testing the validity of the modified roles via
molecule on supported platforms.

This change is adding a pytest that calls molecule to validate
tripleo-repos role on supported platforms.

On CI this change uses a local docker installation but if the developer
wants, (s)he can just define a DOCKER_HOST=ssh://user@server variable
to enable remote execution of the containers (tested).

Change-Id: I2acecc16064b3f155de3e82368c64b060304a5e2
Story: https://tree.taiga.io/project/tripleo-ci-board/us/805
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/663599/

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-06-12 15:09:02.000000000', 'message': "Redirect stderr to stdout in push_cib() and backup_cib()

With this change we are sure we capture any useful logs output by pcs on
stderr:

Before the change:
Error: Unable to write to file '/tmp2/foo.xml', No such file or directory
backup_cib: Running: pcs cluster cib /tmp2/foo.xml with code: 1 ->

After the change:
backup_cib: Running: pcs cluster cib /tmp2/foo.xml with code: 1 -> Error: Unable to write to file '/tmp2/foo.xml', No such file or directory

Change-Id: I41a534e4a162e0f0135c67fe52ed38de7249f091
"}]
commit_message:
Redirect stderr to stdout in push_cib() and backup_cib()

With this change we are sure we capture any useful logs output by pcs on
stderr:

Before the change:
Error: Unable to write to file '/tmp2/foo.xml', No such file or directory
backup_cib: Running: pcs cluster cib /tmp2/foo.xml with code: 1 ->

After the change:
backup_cib: Running: pcs cluster cib /tmp2/foo.xml with code: 1 -> Error: Unable to write to file '/tmp2/foo.xml', No such file or directory

Change-Id: I41a534e4a162e0f0135c67fe52ed38de7249f091

[{'created': '2019-05-07 11:22:10.000000000', 'message': "Get the stack name if possible before running the validations group

If we run the group validations in the Undercloud and we
do not specify the stack name, this will fail if the
Overcloud stack is not called 'overcloud'.

In this case we try to fetch the stack name and we compare it
with the swift containers to match the deployment plan name
if there is a match, then we know the stack name.

Change-Id: Ib2e27b1b43f573385c089e57bd2290daac49d814
Closes-Bug: 1806684
Resolves: rhbz#1573120
(cherry picked from commit 227ce3fc90e5b07d7902ee6299e65b2c2ba9cf9b)
"}]
commit_message:
Get the stack name if possible before running the validations group

If we run the group validations in the Undercloud and we
do not specify the stack name, this will fail if the
Overcloud stack is not called 'overcloud'.

In this case we try to fetch the stack name and we compare it
with the swift containers to match the deployment plan name
if there is a match, then we know the stack name.

Change-Id: Ib2e27b1b43f573385c089e57bd2290daac49d814
Closes-Bug: 1806684
Resolves: rhbz#1573120
(cherry picked from commit 227ce3fc90e5b07d7902ee6299e65b2c2ba9cf9b)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-06-11 21:21:30.000000000', 'message': "Remove _ContextAuthPlugin.get_endpoint* workaround

When common KSA config was enabled for glance, a number of bugs were
discovered and worked around via a shim around keystoneauth1's
Adapter.get_endpoint() method [1].

One of these bugs was resolved in keystoneauth1 [2] which has been in
keystoneauth1 since 3.3.0, so this commit removes it.

[1] I4e755b9c66ec8bc3af0393e81cffd91c56064717
[2] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/500956/
Related-Bug: #1709118

Change-Id: Ifc53c4ea751cf6f5f32af66de04397f2bfba9ba1
"}]
commit_message:
Remove _ContextAuthPlugin.get_endpoint* workaround

When common KSA config was enabled for glance, a number of bugs were
discovered and worked around via a shim around keystoneauth1's
Adapter.get_endpoint() method [1].

One of these bugs was resolved in keystoneauth1 [2] which has been in
keystoneauth1 since 3.3.0, so this commit removes it.

[1] I4e755b9c66ec8bc3af0393e81cffd91c56064717
[2] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/500956/
Related-Bug: #1709118

Change-Id: Ifc53c4ea751cf6f5f32af66de04397f2bfba9ba1

commit_message:
List the Train cycle signing key as current

This sets the end date for the Stein key, adds the Train key
starting today and links to a minimal export of the corresponding
public key and its details on the keyserver network. The key
material change (Depends-On below) merged and went into effect
2019-06-11.

Change-Id: I843d7025341e4226cbdb70572d1960096fdd0bfc
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/664675

commit_message:
masakari: Drop hacking tests

We don't want to depend on pep8/hacking and it's useless to run these
tests again during package build.

Change-Id: I3d70d1553c9b98a52c2978553005cb4bee45bba0

commit_message:
Fix shell upload-to-image with no volume type

Upload-to-image would error after launching
the operation if the volume type is None.

Closes-Bug: #1821818
Change-Id: I015e0ddfa98d62f25334e2df5effaee72a3988ab
(cherry picked from commit 274fa111696783e846561d12f670967ed01ebcbc)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-05-22 14:10:43.000000000', 'message': "WIP - Introduce tripleo::config

tripleo::config is a class that will take care of tripleo.service_name.configs
from Hiera in THT.

Example in THT:

tripleo.aodh_api.configs:
  aodh_config:
    oslo_middleware/enable_proxy_headers_parsing: True

tripleo::config will instanciate tripleo::config::service_configs for
each service, which will call the aodh_config provider for each
parameter and its value, so here it'll call:

create_resources('aodh_config',
                 'oslo_middleware/enable_proxy_headers_parsing' => {
                   'value' => True
                 } )

Change-Id: Ia008917475edcd086fb5076fab320206d05ea557

commit_message:
Introduce tripleo::config

tripleo::config is a class that will take care of param_config in THT.

Example in THT:

puppet_config:
  param_config:
    aodh_config:
      oslo_middleware:
        enable_proxy_headers_parsing: True

tripleo::config will call the aodh_config provider for each
parameter and its value, so here it'll call:

create_resources('aodh_config',
                 'oslo_middleware/enable_proxy_headers_parsing' => {
                   'value' => True
                 } )

Note: we add a filter capability where once can configure
tripleo::config with providers parameter to filter which providers we
want to call.

Change-Id: Ia008917475edcd086fb5076fab320206d05ea557

commit_message:
Revert "opendev.org mirrors: switch out DFW, switch in IAD"

This reverts commit 79cad08fffd85d6c705e7eb2e9162b3d1f67e1de.

The kafs running mirror.iad.rax.opendev.org ended up not servicing
requests in a timely manner. The server had a load >130 and apache was
using at least one full cpu.

Change-Id: I362c53d67a0e1330d02cb1ee6b2bd10bfcc276f6

commit_message:
Make NovaResumeGuestsStateOnHostBoot podman compatible

With podman therefore are changes required to the libvirt-guests
unit file and how we dealt with dependencies of the containers.
With podman systemd is used to manage the containers which we now
can use for container dependencies and use libvirt-guests from
inside a container.

Change-Id: I2a1f370732effd3303942dd5ec46892ec4a85df9
Closes-Bug: #1830067
(cherry picked from commit 6b0d025fd6f5b44428555d12071c700d794a687e)

commit_message:
Don't render None as "null"

In a config file you never want the string "null" in place of a null
value. Just render an empty string instead.

Change-Id: Ibe145c4929d4944cd8d51c07a64aee6fd5f831f2
Closes-Bug: #1830967
Story: 2005797
(cherry picked from commit 75d527ab8fd13185f8db05ad69c43b3c89e06dc3)

This patch removes the option of valid_interfaces, as we're

commit_message:
Use nova credentials when connecting to other APIs

When nova is connecting to another service's API, ex. neutron,
it should use its own credentials to obtain an authtoken when
accessing the other service's API as a client. Only the other
service (eg. neutron) should use its own service credentials
when obtaining auth tokens.

Change-Id: I021f85fd4d08e49876377f87a5cd2fddf54a236f

commit_message:
Fix check-network-gateway validation

The `undercloud.conf` file has now 2 sections (DEFAULT and ctlplane-subnet).
A small numbers of parameters have been deprecated and moved to the
ctlplane-subnet section.

This patch proposes to use the 'ini' custom plugin to get parameter's values
from the undercloud.conf file instead of using the 'undercloud_conf' custom
plugin.

This validation will now get the 'ctlplane-subnet/gateway' instead of
'DEFAULT/network_gateway', which has been deprecated.

Resolves:rhbz#1660088

Change-Id: I15f90676df0eac6172fc4049232754f630cf6eca
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 590b440d5c37dce750ed5aa4d1f30e49266b9f0a)
(cherry picked from commit 984a808493ef04ceba06f6b8f34d3d95443bcf8f)

I would like to see https://review.openstack.org/#/c/460059/ and https://review.openstack.org/#/c/427565/ resolved together one way or another (this comment is posted to both reviews).

From a command format standpoint I think I prefer —cold to —no-live.

I do not like the argparse nargs option, it leads to ambiguous command possibilities.  I don't want the hostname to be optional, maybe —live-auto for the no-host-given version? I am not totally sold on this option name, but do want something that does not involve nargs.

Also, the Compute 2.50 microversion requirement means we have to properly handle the case where we do not have that version available.  Until we get the discovery stuff properly added that means just checking the compute version we do have and acting accordingly.  This means right now for this to work --os-compute-api-version 2.50 needs to be added to the command line."}, {'account_id': 8276, 'date': '2017-07-12 08:06:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Patch Set 5 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-07-12 09:24:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Verified-1

Hi, I'm working on https://review.openstack.org/#/c/490015/ and would like to coordinate some options with you.

I can't find any place in the nova-api where you can specify a host in non-live migration. So how will --no-live <host> actually work?

You're already aware of the unfortunate design choice with "--live" option. Any way we could rename it to an optional "--host", then just use "--live"/"--no-live" for what it's supposed to do?'}, {'account_id': 8276, 'date': '2017-09-05 06:48:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

Hi Erik, the patch of nova-api and novaclient hadn't been merged in master, this's patch https://review.openstack.org/#/c/406707/ . And I completely understand your suggestion about "--host" option, the difficult thing is keeping backward compatible of CLI command. The usage "server migrate --live <host> <vm>" will be broken if we do the change like you mention. Users will find their scripts can't execute when they upgrade openstackclient  to the latest version.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-06-08 13:50:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7: Code-Review-1

commit_message:
Rework server migrate to support live and no-live

Rework for server migrate command options to support all
scenario in group of consistent options.

1.live migrate with host that is choosed by nova automatically
2.live migrate with exact host that is specified by user
3.no-live(cold) migrate with host that is choosed by nova automatically
4.no-live(cold) migrate with exact host that is specified by user
5.add "force" option to make nova don't check the dest host for live and
no-live

Add new option --live-auto to support case #1:
    server migrate --live-auto <server>

Case #2 is already supported:
    server migrate --live <hostname> <server>

Add new option --no-live-auto to support case #3:
    server migrate --no-live-auto <server>
equal with:
    server migrate <server>

Add new option --no-live to support case #4:
    server migrate --no-live <hostname> <server>

Add new option --force to support case #5:
    server migrate --live <hostname> --force <server>
    server migrate --no-live <hostname> --force <server>

Related patches: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/459667/
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/427565/

The patch implement to choose host automatically for live migration,
other parts will be finished in splited patches, code structure in
place.

Closes-Bug: #1411190
Change-Id: Ia1a3111511e0bee6240a4b501f24ff6803172fb4

This would break any scripts in the wild that use the '--live <host>' form, correct? Does osc make any promises about the command line arguments API, so to speak? I feel this potential breakage should at least be mentioned in the release note, not just talk about the new --host option."}, {'account_id': 8768, 'date': '2018-09-27 17:41:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I'm sympathetic with Artom.  Seems like it'd be cleaner to come up with a new argument for "live with no host" instead of repurposing "--live".'}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2018-09-27 17:50:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

This patch would nicely bring openstackclient into parity with novaclient. It is possible through the nova API to live migrate without specifying a host and currently openstackclient is forcing selection of a host for live migration.

But, I also sympathize with the concern about this change potentially breaking existing scripts.'}, {'account_id': 8768, 'date': '2018-09-27 18:48:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

would it be possible to make the hostname optional?  (ie "--live" must be followed by a hostname, another option, or the server name) or is that just not possible given the options framework being used?

that would have the benefit of allowing existing scripts to continue to work.'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2018-09-27 19:09:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-09-27 19:16:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2018-10-02 16:24:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

Artom, OSC has a fairly strict backwards compatibility policy, this would not be accepted as-is.  Monty's solution is a good compromise (I generally avoid nargs as it leads to ambiguity if not carefully applied)

Matt, I generally like having all of the options defined even if they are defaults because defaults change.  In this case I think --cold to echo --live is the correct approach."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-04-01 14:19:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I'm hoping to clear this up once and for all at the Denver Train Forum:

https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/DEN-osc-compute-api-gaps"}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-05-15 22:18:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

I think we can abandon this in favor of https://review.opendev.org/#/c/659382/ now. We can build on that for the cold migrate + --host support but need to fix the live migration stuff first.'}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2019-06-12 17:20:20.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

https://review.opendev.org/#/c/659382/ merged'}]

commit_message:
Refactor 'server migrate'

Add a '--host' option for specification of target host for both
live and cold migrations. The --live parameter will not take a
hostname as it only indicates it is a live-migration from now.

Story: 2003325
Task: 24359
Change-Id: I77379aa622a82b35825db5ff7401e054168e4cd0

commit_message:
Add panko_api_cron container

Currently panko expirer isn't running in a separate container,
which results in events piling up in the configured database.
This change deploys panko_api_cron as a container and
periodically deletes events from db

Change-Id: I4c941048a3561af9458208fe86e1b86156eb7ebc

Fix package name in metadata

Correct package name for Cinder Tempest plugin
is 'cinder-tempest-plugin'. It's used to upload package to
PyPI.

commit_message:
Create new image volume cache entry when cloning fails

This patch fixes the image volume cache so that a new cache entry is
created whenever cloning an existing entry fails (which can happen, for
example, when a cached volume reaches its snapshot limit). This restores
the original behavior, which was broken by [1].

[1] I547fb4bcdd4783225b8ca96d157c61ca3bcf4ef4

Conflicts:
        cinder/tests/unit/volume/flows/test_create_volume_flow.py

Closes-Bug: #1801595
Change-Id: Ib5947e2c7300730adb851ad58e898a29f2b88525
(cherry picked from commit 93519a02c0c9b5dcb9d5139761780bcbdceef982)
(cherry picked from commit b0cf233d808507707f3ccf7c614d3930f2e3eb32)

commit_message:
Add Contributor Docs for Upgrade Checks

We had discussed that we should add some additional contributor
docs on how to create Upgrade Checks. This documentation
provides guidance on what checks are appropriate for
Cinder and how to add a check.  The more comprehensive
Nova documentation is referenced for additional
details.

Change-Id: Id466835566a6ce67d21ea1367fb9280070fdf2e3

commit_message:
Mark Prophetstor Driver Unsupported

The Prophetstor Driver 3rd Party CI hasn't
reported in 188 days.  This does not meet the
requirements for Cinder's 3rd Party CI requirements.

As a result the driver is being marked unsupported in the
Train release and should be removed in the 'U' release if
the problems are not resolved.

Change-Id: I78fe008c3b715f14d61f3fcef4920db5ac037344

commit_message:
Update QoS and add Accuracy Note

We discussed at the last mid-cycle that the definition of QoS
should be updated to indicate this is for backend QoS support.
I have added that clarification with this patch.

I have also added a note that this is not an auto-generated
matrix and the accuracy should be handled accordingly.

Change-Id: Iccc3783997c2709dbc64bed8bd93d034e0fc2920

commit_message:
Publish non-openstack namespace tempest plugins

This commit changes to publish non-openstack namespace tempest plugins
to the tempest registry doc page. We missed some tempest plugins such as
airship's tempest-plugin because of the recent namespace change. And
also, this commit adds two projects[0] to .zuul.yaml because it had
been added already.

This commit republish them on the doc page, and add two projects to the
blacklist to pass the sanity tests.

Change-Id: Ieecb8989ff8959f1b2c0e5f2f6b8ea2c3ebbcaa9

[{'created': '2019-06-12 05:54:11.000000000', 'message': 'opendev.org mirrors: switch out DFW, switch in IAD

We have identified issues with openafs meaning the DFW opendev.org
mirror is unstable.  The IAD mirror is running a (currently
hand-installed) version of kafs to provide the mirror directories (the
host is currently in the emergency file).

Switch in IAD for testing kafs, and switch out DFW which is giving
occasional errors to jobs.

Change-Id: I5115030cd323db459b248e21413b68f0ad0aafa8
'}]
commit_message:
opendev.org mirrors: switch out DFW, switch in IAD

We have identified issues with openafs meaning the DFW opendev.org
mirror is unstable.  The IAD mirror is running a (currently
hand-installed) version of kafs to provide the mirror directories (the
host is currently in the emergency file).

Switch in IAD for testing kafs, and switch out DFW which is giving
occasional errors to jobs.

Change-Id: I5115030cd323db459b248e21413b68f0ad0aafa8

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-05-29 19:45:13.000000000', 'message': "Improve iSCSI device detection speed

Current iSCSI device detection checks for the presence of devices based
on the scan time, so it checks for presence, sleeps, scans, and checks
again.  This means that if the device becomes available while we sleep
to send another scan we won't detect the device.

This patch changes this, making the searching and the rescanning
independent operations operating at different cadences.

Checking for the device will happen every seconds, and the rescans will
happen after 4, 9, and 16 seconds.

Change-Id: I716a3ea8583e289819cc37b6b5dd9730dd59406b
(cherry picked from commit aecf9c968bf9f395d746572cc32671e76251e9d2)
"}]
commit_message:
Improve iSCSI device detection speed

Current iSCSI device detection checks for the presence of devices based
on the scan time, so it checks for presence, sleeps, scans, and checks
again.  This means that if the device becomes available while we sleep
to send another scan we won't detect the device.

This patch changes this, making the searching and the rescanning
independent operations operating at different cadences.

Checking for the device will happen every seconds, and the rescans will
happen after 4, 9, and 16 seconds.

Change-Id: I716a3ea8583e289819cc37b6b5dd9730dd59406b
(cherry picked from commit aecf9c968bf9f395d746572cc32671e76251e9d2)

commit_message:
Re-enable manila dashboard

The Shared File Systems service (manila) provides
a dashboard plugin that needs to be enabled by
tripleo. It appears that it was disabled inadvertently
while triaging a bug with the dashboard and sqlite.

See: Launchpad bug #1766184
and associated commit: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/613186/

commit_message:
Retire independent ansible role

This role has been retired. The transformation squad is pivoting away from
independent roles at this time and will be focusing on the tripleo-ansible
repository. For more information on the tripleo-ansible efforts and the
direction of the transformation squad please review the following mailing
list thread [0].

[0] - http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-June/006836.html

Change-Id: I006434ebedff04acd66a0fc2321914c1872c84b0
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add cassandra-driver buildrequires

The tests have been updated to actually call relevant
code that imports cassandra-driver, so it needs to be
available in the build environment.

Change-Id: Ief4471412099467f575c8bd55afd971c0bf4d2b6

commit_message:
Get the hostname of the introspected host

This will retrieve the hostname of the host being introspected, and
return it as part of the introspection data.

Change-Id: I54084251e1b0f3a40fe5ac760b2a7e45199c9fdb
Story: #2005867
Task: #33674

Discussed a bit on IRC[1], here's where I think we're standing, with apologies to frickler for reversing my earlier suggestions:

* having the new config option is good
* don't issue a deprecation warning for changing the hardcoded value, rather document it in release notes and maybe even broadcast it on the mailing list
* default should be 'internal', not 'public'. Most existing deployments probably have segmented networks where 'admin' and 'internal' may be the same but 'public' is not.

[1] http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/irclogs/%23openstack-keystone/%23openstack-keystone.2019-05-28.log.html#t2019-05-28T17:45:01"}, {'account_id': 13252, 'date': '2019-05-29 13:41:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 13252, 'date': '2019-05-29 15:09:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10:

defaulting to the internal endpoint doesn't work in gate because devstack doesn't set up internal endpoints it seems:

http://logs.openstack.org/90/651790/10/check/tempest-full/10c44bb/controller/logs/screen-g-api.txt.gz#_May_29_14_28_35_930698

so I'm back to suggesting to use public as default. deployers concerned about security can still override to internal.

waiting for feedback before giving it another spin"}, {'account_id': 1916, 'date': '2019-05-29 17:35:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10:

commit_message:
Add a new option to choose the Identity endpoint

Previously the admin Identity endpoint was hardcoded to be used. Now
that keystone has dropped v2 support, deploying an admin Identity
endpoint is no longer useful, so allow this to be changed by the
deployer. Keep the default as using the `admin` endpoint, but create
a deprecation message so that we can change the default in the future.

Partial-Bug: 1830002
Change-Id: I993a45ccb1109d67e65bf32d1e134cc9bec2d88e
